programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former pub landlady Janice Gibson wants to swap her Newcastle lifestyle for a new start in the Mar Menor area of southern Spain, so Laura Hamilton shows her a selection of properties starting from around £55,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Lesley Wall and Raspal Chima find a holiday home in Spain's province of Seville, with a view to spending half the year there when they eventually retire. With a budget of £150,000, the couple are amazed at how far their money will stretch.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of £180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Blackpool couple Julie and Brent Birnie find a holiday home close to Florida's theme park capital, Orlando. They're amazed by what their budget of £70,000 can buy them, but it remains to be seen which property will suit them best.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps south London couple Simone and Carlton search for a new home on Barbados. They have a budget of £150,000 and hope they can achieve their 17-year dream of moving to the island after they enjoyed their first holiday there as a couple, and returned five years later to be married.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a couple searching for a house in East Sussex that is far away from neighbours without being remote, as well as a woman looking for a home in the Cotswolds.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Randy DeWitt, the CEO and co-founder of bar and grill chain Twin Peaks, goes undercover to find out whether the company's culture is keeping up with its rapid growth. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps newly retired Carlene Barnard find a holiday home in Torrevieja on the Costa Blanca that has plenty of room for her two children and their families.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows Fay Lewis five properties on the Costa del Sol, hoping that on a budget of £95,000, one of them will prove to be her dream home.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows software executive Andy and garden designer Nicki, who are planning to build a `floating' house on the Thames, which would be the first of its kind in the UK. Their architect has come up with an ambitious, experimental design that would see the whole property magically rise up with the flood waters. However, no one knows whether it will work, and the project soon becomes bogged down in the logistical challenges of bringing to fruition such a complex structure on a small island that is only accessible by a narrow footbridge.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: The mystery of red rain falling in Sri Lanka and India, how unusual weather is making Florida the sinkhole capital of the world, and strange lights in the sky that are baffling locals in a remote Norwegian town. Plus, ready-made snowballs in Alaska, giant spiderwebs covering trees in Pakistan, shard of ice sprouting from the ground in someone's back garden, and an underwater cloud in Mexico.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Kaneez is initially furious to discover that Nas is considering the arranged marriage, but the pressure of planning the wedding and her web of lies leads Nas to break down to her mum and confess that she is gay. While focusing on helping Missy get Hayley back and also straightening out Simone, Emma neglects Chloe on her birthday, sending Chloe off the rails, while Steve battles with Mandy's indiscretion, leaving him wondering whether they have a future together after all.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of Brothers and Sisters.
programme.desc: Documentary, filmed during a family camping holiday in the woods, exploring what it is like to be a younger sibling, including how they assert their independence around dominant older brothers and sisters. Scientists follow the children's every move and have devised a series of tasks, including nature sculptures, quizzes and tugs of war, to put their relationships to the test.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from south Wales compete to host the best dinner party and win the £1,000 prize, beginning with beautician Rachael and her partner Nick, who prepare a selection of dishes they've never made before. Dionne and Ameel prepare an Indian-inspired meal on the second night of the competition, before Angela and Jeff hope their no-nonsense menu can secure them the money.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, London Road Pawnbrokers boss Dan hunts for a local artist regarding potentially valuable paintings, and an unusual silver sombrero could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry Kohen and Neil McLaughlin at Cashbrokers pawnbrokers go out to sea to test-drive a jet ski. Meanwhile, Lee has Crufts memorabilia he wants to sell, Dan and his team consider a houseboat, and a Picasso is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples who are struggling to find suitable flats in Edinburgh because of the competitive market and their demanding search criteria. The first, Matt, a professional rugby player and his girlfriend Amy, have viewed more than 100 properties without success. The second pair, Sarah and Dom, are relocating from London with their one-year-old son and have a £600,000 budget, but too many special requirements for their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in the Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by his friend, fellow B&B owner Jeronime Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity manager Andrew Batsford hosts the first of a week of parties from Hastings, aiming to inspire his fellow contestants with a menu of dishes prepared using foraged ingredients, including sea broccoli and stinging nettles. However, if the food fails to win them over, he hopes a dynamic Wham!-themed evening of festivities will do the trick.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Hastings, East Sussex, and retired solicitor Adrian Carter is hoping to impress his guests with a Moroccan-themed evening. However, disaster strikes when he neglects his tagine, and his rendition of a Rod Stewart classic does not go down well either.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sally-Anne Keller hosts a German-themed dinner party on the third night in Hastings, East Sussex, and requires her guests to dress, sing and dance accordingly. Charity manager Andrew Batsford explains how the principles of anarchism and punk can be applied to football, while retired solicitor Adrian Carter dresses as the 19th-century statesman Otto von Bismarck and raises eyebrows with his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Kate Eadon hosts the fourth dinner party in Hastings, East Sussex, with a menu styled on a gourmet pub meal. Adrian Carter gets himself in hot water, Sally-Anne Keller reveals a surprise celebrity crush, and the host recounts her own encounter with a famous funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Stewart and Elmor visit Nottingham to chase almost £8,000 owed by a car dealership to a dissatisfied customer, while on the Isle of Wight, Brian and Del try to collect £3,700 of unpaid estate agency fees. In Lancashire, Stewart and Iain struggle to identify the person who owes almost £2,000 after a failed compensation claim, while Del and Dael try to recover nearly £3,500 from a businessman in West London.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on claimants living by the sea. programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Living the High Life.
programme.desc: The documentary about people fighting to make ends meet catches up with some of those featured in earlier editions. With a new agent and book deal on the horizon, she enjoys a VIP night out which gets the attention of the paparazzi. programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: On the heels of the self-financed, modestly budgeted 2007 drama Youth Without Youth -- his first directorial outing after a ten-year hiatus -- filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola remains situated in the director's chair for this semi-autobiographical family drama concerning an artistic family of immigrants whose fierce rivalries span several generations. Vincent Gallo stars with newcomer Alden Ehrenreich, with Carmen Maura, Maribel Verdú, and Alden Ehrenreich rounding out the cast(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Director Roger Michell follows up the hit romantic comedy Notting Hill with this thought-provoking thriller. Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. A recovering alcoholic, Doyle's tardiness doesn't sit well with the judge, who - sick of waiting for Gipson - grants custody to Doyle's ex-wife in Doyle's absence. The situation worsens when it becomes evident that Doyle has an equally important file belonging to Gavin, which proves that an elderly man gave Banek's firm power-of-attorney over his foundation. So begins an escalating war of words and deeds between the two men. Soon, egged on by an associate, Gavin hires a "fixer" to destroy Doyle's credit, forcing Doyle to fire back with some cunning moves of his own(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Vince Vaughn stars as Santa's loser older brother Fred, forced into helping out the elves after Saint Nick (Paul Giamatti) bails him out of trouble. Comedic violence. (2008)(118 mins)(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Mike Myers returns as master spy Austin Danger Powers (and, of course, his arch enemy Dr Evil) with a new sidekick in Felicity Shagwell (Heather Graham - The Guru). Dr Evil has invented a time machine and gone back in time to steal Powers' sexual powers, leaving our hero in 1999 without the ability to perform. Not only does he have to rescue his libido but he must also thwart Dr Evil's plan to devastate Earth with a moon-based laser(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Chris Rock directed, co-wrote and stars in this hilarious farce about an obscure politician whose campaign for president surprisingly gains momentum. He plays Mays Gilliam, a dedicated D.C. alderman, who astonishes his detractors when his folksy campaign catches fire(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: One-hit wonder Jackie Moon uses his musical earnings to buy a basketball team, but must fight to keep his side in the game(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Exhilarating biopic of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens (Stephan James) and his inspiring journey to overcome racism at home and abroad, culminating in his triumphant track and field performance at the 1936 Berlin Olympics under the tutelage of gruff Ohio State coach Larry Snyder (Jason Sudeikis) and the skeptical gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Hereafter tells the story of three people who are touched by death in different ways. George is a blue-collar American who has a special connection to the afterlife. On the other side of the world, Marie, a French journalist, has a near-death experience that shakes her reality. And when Marcus, a London schoolboy, loses the person closest to him, he desperately needs answers. Each on a path in search of the truth, their lives will intersect, forever changed by what they believe might or must exist in the hereafter(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: New York, 1975. Carlito Brigante, a Puerto Rican drug dealer, is released from jail after serving five years. He vows to go straight and to live life as a fine, upstanding citizen. He even rekindles a romance with his ex-lover. However, Carlito's old associates cannot seem to leave him in peace. His nephew involves him a pool-room gunfight, his lawyer asks him for 'favours' which spiral out of control, and even an old friend tries to get him into trouble with the law. Carlito decides to make a run for Florida and the promise of a new life, but has one final dramatic escape to make from a gang of criminals who believe that he was behind the murder of their boss(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a new life is just what Johnny, Sarah and their two plucky daughters need. America might be the land of the free, but without money, New York is fierce and daunting for the young Irish family(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke, her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Warped, crudely funny comedy about a boozy conman who robs the department stores where he works as Santa(n)

programme.title: Casanova
programme.desc: History's most renowned ladies' man finally meets his match in this historical romance laced with comedy and adventure. In Venice in 1753, Giacomo Casanova (Heath Ledger) is a notorious playboy whose way with women goes too far when he's caught leaving the bedroom of a novice nun, and one of the leading prosecutors of the Inquisition, Pucci (Jeremy Irons), puts him on trial. The Doge (Tim McInnerny), Venice's political point man, is a friend of Casanova's and pulls strings to get him off the hook and allow him to stay in the city, but under one condition -- he must take a wife and remain faithful to her. Casanova sets his sights on Victoria (Natalie Dormer), a lovely young maiden who is obviously taken with the handsome ladykiller, but he's not the only one who wants her hand. Giovanni Bruni (Charlie Cox) is a young man who is very much in love with Victoria, and in order to move him out of the picture, Casanova challenges him to a duel. However, when Casanova is bested in swords in the challenge, he discovers he's actually been parrying with Giovanni's sister, Francesca (Sienna Miller). As Casanova gets to know Francesca, he discovers she's a gifted writer and a bright and independent woman as well as a good hand with a sword, and he comes to the realization that she's the woman he wants to take to the altar. However, Francesca has already been promised to the vain and chubby Papprizzio (Oliver Platt), a man she's never met, and she doesn't seem at all interested in the notorious Casanova. Casanova also stars Lena Olin, and Omid Djalili(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: A young artist struggling with his career and his muse is getting more than a little aggravation from Cupid in this romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry Falk (Jason Biggs) is a promising 21-year-old comedy writer living in New York City. While Jerry has talent, he's having a hard time getting his career off the ground, which might have something to do with the fact his agent Harvey (Danny DeVito) is a well-meaning, but ineffectual, blowhard, and his mentor David Dobel (Allen) is an increasingly paranoid eccentric whose twin careers as a teacher and standup comic are both floundering. Poised at the top of Jerry's mountain of anxieties is his relationship with his girlfriend Amanda (Christina Ricci); from the first moment he saw her, Jerry has been in love with her, but Amanda's multiple neuroses, fear of commitment, and frustrating intimacy issues make her all but impossible to be around. Jerry is approaching his breaking point when the small flat he shares with Amanda becomes home to a third roommate -- Amanda's mother Paula (Stockard Channing), who has decided to come to New York to chase her dream of becoming a cabaret singer. Anything Else also features supporting performances from Jimmy Fallon, William Hill, and jazz vocalist Diana Krall(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL."(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Writer-producer-director-star Ben Stiller wears many hats (and plenty of outrageous outfits) in this goofy satire about the fashion industry. Stiller plays a dim male model who falls from grace and becomes involved in an assassination plot. Owen Wilson, Christine Taylor, Will Ferrell, Jerry Stiller, Milla Jovovich, David Duchovny, Jon Voight(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Third in the series of high-speed action thrillers about maverick New York cop John McClane. This time the death-defying lawman, suspended from the force, goes up against a madman who is threatening to detonate bombs all over Manhattan. McClane pulls out all the stops as he races against the clock to save the city. En route, a hostile Harlem shopkeeper becomes his reluctant partner in the adventure(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: A maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket after the latter is framed for a bombing in Paris. Soon, they combine their brawn and street smarts to investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Norma and Arthur Lewis are a charming, loving couple; he a research scientist at Nasa's Langley facility and she is a teacher. Early one morning a mysterious box is left at their door. Hours later, a gentleman with a badly burned face arrives to tell them that if they push the red button on top of the box they will receive one million dollars, but someone they don't know will die. They have 24 hours to choose. He will then return to collect the box(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Halle Berry's Oscar-winning performance highlights this wrenching tale about racism, redemption and the power of love. She plays a poor Southerner who falls for a prison guard (Billy Bob Thornton) following the execution of her husband (played by rapper Sean Combs). Peter Boyle, Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Paradise
programme.desc: Young businesswoman Tamara receives an inheritance that turns her into an overnight millionaire, so she treats her friends to an all-expenses-paid holiday in Hawaii, where she soon falls for Italian yachtsman Dario. But when her friend Dena is attacked, the simultaneous disappearance of both Tamara's money and her new beau sends her on a vengeance-fuelled mission. Thriller, starring Boti Bliss, Antonio Sabato Jr, Danny Adams and Megan Blake.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a teenage TV talent show contestant is found dumped underneath a highway flyover, and CCTV footage implicates a fellow contestant, who is immediately brought in for questioning. However, a new lead prompts Grissom and the team to re-examine an unsolved case from the 1950s. With The Birds star Tippi Hedren.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Stitch in Crime
programme.desc: Surgeon Barry Mayfield decides he needs get rid of his colleague to speed along a research project. When his partner requires heart surgery, Mayfield performs the operation himself and discreetly arranges some fatal complications. However, when he also murders a nurse who suspects the truth, he attracts the attention of the slovenly sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Leonard Nimoy and Will Geer.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Uneasy Lies the Crown
programme.desc: A dentist with gambling debts discovers his wife is having an affair with one of his patients and wants a divorce. He plans to take revenge by poisoning the lover with his wife's heart medication, so she will be suspected - but he reckons without the attentions of the crumpled cop. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, James Read, Paul Burke, Jo Anderson and Nancy Walker.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Double Exposure
programme.desc: A maker of motivational films based on subliminal messages uses his expertise to plant a subconscious command in the mind of a rival to lure him to his death. However, any hopes of his getting away with it are dashed by the arrival of a certain shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Culp, Robert Middleton, Louise Latham and Arlene Martel.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: In the wake of Baitfish's death, Pride suspects a mole is among the ranks. When the team members learn of a security breach at the New Orleans cargo ports, they fear this might be the very thing Baitfish taunted them about just prior to his untimely demise. Pride contemplates whether the threat could be something to do with the Broussard Syndicate, the crime family that has been one step ahead of him all year, so authorises his unit to cover every angle conceivable to ensure the city's safety.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: As an army convoy on a military exercise crosses a bridge, an unseen person detonates an IED, destroying the bridge and dropping a state-of-the-art guided missile into the river below. Below the waterline, divers wait and pick up their prize. After identifying those responsible, Pride puts himself on the line by going undercover to find out what they plan to do with their newly acquired weapon. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Four seemingly unrelated individuals are killed in a controlled bombing at a Pasadena restaurant, but as the NCIS officers dig deeper, they discover a link between the victims - all were members of an experimental strategy game developed by the Office of Naval Intelligence. The question is, who wanted them dead - and why? Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac is found at the harbour in Jersey City, having escaped from a sinking car, but he is suffering from concussion and can recall only scant details of his kidnapping. However, the team resolves to track down his abductor and believes CCTV footage of the suspect driving through a toll barrier in another vehicle is just the lead required. Starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The team embarks on a desperate search to find the source of a radioactive substance that claimed a woman's life at a concert and hospitalised Sid, who was exposed to it while examining the body. Evidence leads them to the antiquities section of the New York library - and the finger of suspicion points to a former employee who bore a grudge. Guest starring Maroon 5.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A student's body is found dumped in an area frequented by prostitutes, and it soon becomes clear she was deeply involved in the worlds of online gambling and high-stakes poker. As the investigation proceeds, Stabler and Tutuola find themselves on the trail of a famous American footballer and an undercover police officer. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Fin's son Ken is caught trying to dig up a body at night, and arrested on suspicion of murder. At the police station he is found to have been covering for his cousin. However, the guilty party later uses a technicality to have his confession ruled inadmissible. Guest starring Chris `Ludacris' Bridges and Ernest Waddell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson's professional relationship with Stabler comes under increasing pressure as they pursue a serial sex offender who has killed a couple and kidnapped their two children. As the case unfolds, she is attacked by their quarry - and responds by asking to work with another partner in future. Guest starring Lou Diamond Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler is teamed up with a new partner to investigate a sexual assault on a 16-year-old girl who has had her finger severed. Though the newcomer's treatment of teenage suspects causes friction between the two detectives, they focus on discovering the reasons for the assault - and learn that the victim herself was a bully. Anthony Anderson and Natalie Cole guest star alongside Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Tutuola investigate an eight-year-old boy's claims that he has been abused, and discover his family has a turbulent history. The case soon develops into a kidnap mystery, and Benson, enjoying her new job in the computer-crime unit, is drafted in to help resolve matters. With guest star Kate Mulgrew (Star Trek: Voyager).(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett and Castle investigate the ritualistic murder of a young woman, and suspect a religious conspiracy is behind it, as symbols on the woman's body and the items left in her apartment seem reminiscent of The Da Vinci Code. Meanwhile, the author struggles with Alexis' decision to move with Pi into their own apartment. Nathan Fillion stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A baseball star becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his limousine driver, who had been regularly supplying him with steroids. Briscoe and Green's investigation reveals blackmail as the underlying motive for the crime. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The charred body of an Asian girl is found outside the apartment of the Chinese consul general. Forensics discover she was murdered before her corpse was burned, prompting detectives to investigate rumours that the diplomat is somehow connected. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom and Riley investigate a double fatality at a street party in Las Vegas's Korean district. Evidence links the victims to a criminal organisation known for its connections to the vice industry. However, a discovery at the crime scene sheds new light on the case, and sets the team off in search of a youngster who may be the killer's next target. Starring William Petersen and Lauren Lee Smith.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.desc: A married couple are struggling with their crumbling relationship when the wife receives a letter informing her that she has a previously unknown long-lost twin sister. The husband then begins a torrid affair with his newfound sister-in-law, but soon finds she is treacherous and dangerous. Thriller, starring Sonya Walger and Ben Bass.(n)

programme.desc: A married couple are struggling with their crumbling relationship when the wife receives a letter informing her that she has a previously unknown long-lost twin sister. The husband then begins a torrid affair with his newfound sister-in-law, but soon finds she is treacherous and dangerous. Thriller, starring Sonya Walger and Ben Bass.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in the East River leads Briscoe and Green to investigate the drug-addicted brother of a famous footballer - and as the case unfolds, it becomes clear she may not have been the killer's only victim. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green think they have got their man when the prime suspect in a murder investigation knows every detail about the killing. However, when he claims he acquired his information from a psychic vision, the detectives have their work cut out. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The return of the crime drama. The fire department and the police are celebrating Mac's recovery at an ice-hockey game when both services are called away to deal with a blaze, which triggers an explosion that kills one of those attending the scene. Evidence leads Mac and the team to arsonist Leonard Brooks, who has just been released from prison after serving 15 years. Rob Morrow (Numb3rs) guest stars, with Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. Meanwhile, Tony and McGee try to find the perfect woman for Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is found on the side of a remote road and toxicology tests reveal he died of overhydration. When another man is found dead nearby, the NCIS team begins to suspect a serial killer is on the loose. Meanwhile, Ducky introduces Gibbs to his new girlfriend. Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A hit-and-run driver kills a man working on the campaign for an aspiring senator, but it soon becomes a case of national security when closer examination of the video footage makes it clear he was murdered. The agents' job is to figure out whether it is an isolated incident or part of a politically motivated plot that might put others in danger - and most of the pressure is on Kensi, who takes the victim's old job and goes undercover in the campaign office.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman stops taking her medication and kills 10 people with her car - but the blame for the offence falls on a former rock star waging a campaign against psychiatric drugs. Under pressure from Cragen, a sympathetic Novak has no choice but to pursue a prosecution - and the trial attracts intense media attention. Guest starring Norman Reedus (The Walking Dead).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson visits a woman who arrived at the hospital with her head shaved, having been raped. When the victim refuses to submit to testing, unorthodox methods are called for to acquire evidence, but further investigation reveals the case has implications beyond sexual assault. Drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Kristen Bush.(n)

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: Jane Austen might never have imagined that her 1816 novel Emma could be turned into a fresh and satirical look at ultra-rich teenagers in a Beverly Hills high school. Cher (Alicia Silverstone) and Dionne (Stacey Dash), both named after "great singers of the past that now do infomercials," are pampered upper-class girls who care less about getting good grades than wearing the right clothes and being as popular as possible. But Cher, who lives with her tough yet warm-hearted lawyer dad (Dan Hedaya) and hunky, sensitive stepbrother (Paul Rudd), also has an innate urge to help those less fortunate -- like the two introverted teachers she brings together ("negotiating" herself improved grades in the process) and new friend Tai (Brittany Murphy), who starts out a geek and ends up a Cher prodigy. Cher also possesses her own sensitive side, and she is looking for the perfect boyfriend, whom she ends up finding where she least expected(n)

He tries to protect his macho persona against her squeaky clean image, but the tables are turned when Sandy, in a leather costume so tight Newton-John had to be sewn into it, wins his heart. programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: Lightning War. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents and modern techniques of colouring and satellite mapping. Germany took just four weeks to conquer Poland, using a new form of warfare - Blitzkrieg. Six armoured tank units known as Panzer divisions, supported by the Luftwaffe, quickly broke through Polish defences and were so successful that Hitler also used them against the Allies. Despite superior men and equipment, France and England had not learned the lessons of the Polish defeat and were utterly at a loss how to counter such attacks. (Followed by News)(n)

programme.desc: A Healthy Dose of ATM. Wayde and Brett tackle a request for a syringe-shaped aquarium for Cooper Family Medical in Florida. But will it be a shot in the arm for the resourceful duo?(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Popcorn on the High Seas. The Popcorn Girl commissions ATM to transform a vintage popcorn maker into a tank. And later the boys fabricate a Navy-inspired sailboat aquarium(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Sweet Memories. Wayde and Brett of Acrylic Tank Manufacturing design a wide variety of intriguing and ingenious tanks for holding a range of animals. What will they create today?(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NASCAR and Baseball Champions Tanks!. NASCAR Champion Ryan Newman gets ATM to make a desk aquarium and Red Sox star Shane Victorino asks the guys to build a Hawaiian themed tank(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Fish-a-Palooza. Brett and Wayde recall the rare sea creatures involved in their most memorable aquarium-building experiences(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Medievil Protection. Brett and Wayde build a dragon guarded gem filled aquarium for a family in California. A few hours away the guys go on a mission to build an army tank(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The Hoff Gets a Tank. In the season premiere, actor David Hasselhoff wants an aquarium that recalls his time on "Baywatch" and "Knight Rider," and the job includes an inspirational trip to the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach, Cal(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Extreme Pond Off! Wayde vs. Brett
programme.desc: Extreme Pond Off! Wayde vs. Brett. No additional information is available(n)

programme.desc: Higher Purpose. Two tiger cubs that are growing fast get ready to move to the adult enclosure; a silverback gorilla receives treatment for glaucoma; a zookeeper plays matchmaker for a pair of birds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Moving Day. A male sea lion is in a rut, so the staff must move the younger ones before he becomes territorial; a flamingo has a broken ankle; feeding a rock python presents a challenge(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Handle With Care. A tomistoma, or freshwater crocodile, stops laying eggs; a baby antelope must be rescued when it's not getting the necessary care from its mother; Mert the goose takes a field trip(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Birds and the Bees. A snow leopard named Leo that was rescued from Pakistan has trouble eating because of a broken tooth; the bird department works fast to restore a beehive; a fennec fox gets extra attention from the Ambassador Center staff(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Walk on the Wild Side. The zoo's conservation work with American bison involves an embryo transfer program between two herds thousands of miles apart. Meanwhile, a diamondback rattlesnake fighting an infection requires oral medication; and the Ambassador Center staff trains two cheetahs to stroll comfortably among humans on the grounds(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Love Shack. An elaborate hut is built for a pair of kiwis to breed; a king cobra arrives at the zoo, but it's not easy training it to move from the exhibit to a holding pen(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: Back to the Bronx
programme.desc: Back to Africa. A journey to eastern Africa is undertaken to return thousands of toads to the wild that were rescued from extinction. Also: A giraffe tries out a new piece of equipment; the avian department works to save the lives of millions of birds(n)

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Steve and the Dragon. Host Steve Irwin investigates the remote islands of Indonesia to observe the huge Komodo dragon, the largest lizard in the world(n)

programme.title: Dogs 101
programme.sub-title: Kooikerhondje, Tibetan Mastiff, Dandie Dinmont Terrier, Leonberger, Affenpinscher
programme.desc: Kooikerhondje, Tibetan Mastiff, Dandie Dinmont Terrier, Leonberger, Affenpinscher. Breeds spotlighted include the Kooikerhondje, Tibetan mastiff, Dandie Dinmont terrier, Leonberger and affenpinscher(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: Kittens in Wonderland. Tabby kittens befriend a bearded dragon; Burmese kittens explore their new home; Siberian kittens vie for their mother's attention(n)

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: My Boyfriend vs. My Cat. Model Adrianne Curry appears in the Season 7 premiere when she and her boyfriend struggle to coexist with her Siamese cat, Billy Shears. Meanwhile, a college student feels like she's being held prisoner by her bloodthirsty cat, Storm(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Down to Business. Investigators tread carefully on a trail of bloody footprints that belong to a dog in distress; the fire department lends a hand when a cat is stuck 40 feet up in a palm tree(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Chain Break. An underweight Rottweiler is chained in the blazing sun; a search is on for kittens trapped under roof tiles; a dog that was attacked by coyotes fights for its life(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: The Next Chapter. Tia prepares to move to a new facility(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Life in the Spotlight. Highlights of the second season are featured(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Weed It and Reap. An Amish family needs help keeping a bear out of their corn crop; a man is hiding from the law in a cabin; a search is on for an illegal marijuana farmer(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Excuses, Excuses. Herring calls for air support to observe illegal activity on a game preserve; Blanchard catches a criminal in the act; Carter and McBrine search for a poacher(n)

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Collision Course. Three-hundred miles south of the Arctic Circle, Cathy and Larry battle freezing temperatures which threaten to leave them without a crucial supply of fresh water(n)

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Avalanche Zone. Offgrid, Josh and Annie urgently need to move their cabin away from a rapidly rising river. On the railroad, an avalanche threatens to derail a mile and a half train(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: Summer Heating. Summer is coming to an end, so the Kilchers need to get ready to create their own heat, which means stockpiling firewood and using some frontier ingenuity to build a new stove(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: Breaking Ground. The dwindling of summer months finds everyone scrambling to finish a number of tasks, including salvaging, salmon harvesting and construction on a new cabin for the winter(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: Fish Gone Foul. The end of the summer harvest gives the Kilchers no breaks from Mother Nature as a fishing trip goes awry and a beehive colony is dying off for unknown reasons(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: The Fall Hunt. The change of seasons has reached the frontier and the Kilchers will need to hunt and search for food in more dangerous and remote locations to sustain their winter stockpiles(n)

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier: The Frozen Edge
programme.desc: Cattle Drive Tribute. The Kilchers lose a friend as winter approaches and they'll have to drive his herd of cattle after his passing, but the journey is as emotional as it is rough and rugged(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Samanthi Flanagan present discussion of transgender issues and organ donation, while Jerry Springer considers possible future presidential candidates in the US.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Lincoln, antiques experts Charlie Ross and Richard Madley assist two teams comprising twin sisters and best friends competing to buy three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Presenter Eric Knowles keeps his eye on proceedings and also enjoys an appointment with royalty.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents continued coverage from The Olympic Stadium in London, where the ninth meeting of the Diamond League campaign takes place. Mo Farah is expected to return to the scene of arguably his most notable triumph and compete at this year's games, alongside fellow British stars such as Katarina Johnson-Thompson, Laura Muir, Greg Rutherford, and six-time Paralympic champion David Weir, who is scheduled to compete in the final race of his illustrious career.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to north Wales to help a recently retired couple find a rural retreat on a budget of £400,000. While in the region, the presenter also catches up with a pair who longed to lead a self-sufficient lifestyle and found their ideal home three years earlier.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Mont St Michel in France to meet modern-day pilgrims and discover the history of the monastery. Josie D'Arby explores a link with a similar site in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: How to Holiday Better
programme.desc: Cherry Healey and Ade Adepitan find the perfect holiday for members of the public. Plus, Richard Madeley and Steph McGovern present guides to Venice and Oman.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a groundbreaking project in Northamptonshire to incorporate wildlife conservation into a retail park. John Craven visits a micro-tannery and goes in search of an elusive butterfly, Adam Henson finds out about an insect farm in Cumbria, and Tom Heap reports on homelessness in rural areas.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art expert Philip Mould visit a B&B in Aberdeenshire to pick up where the owner's late husband left off in proving that a painting is the work of 19th-century French artist Paul Delaroche. A visit to the British museum raises evidence that this could be a lost treasure once belonging to France's last king and queen, and they head for Normandy to inspect a stained glass window in the image of a lost Delaroche painting - but they also begin to suspect it is a copy, rather than the original.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: The French Royalists plan an invasion, which Caroline hopes will lead to Dwight's release. However, Ross is convinced this will only make matters worse, and recruits a band of allies, including Tholly, Zacky, Drake and Henshawe, to help him free Dwight from prison. George schemes to further his political ambitions, and when he learns of Ross' plan, he uses it as a means to discredit his rival, accusing him of recklessness - a charge that may prove true when the rescue mission proves to have fatal consequences.(n)

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Young landlords Dan and Jamie are given a reality check in Co Durham when they move into their tenant Michael's home. At first, they are blase about the jobs that need doing, but when they come face to face with Michael everything is thrown into question. In Leeds, old feelings and difficult memories are raked up for millionaire Prab when he is taken back to his own impoverished childhood.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis return to reveal more ways in which consumers can save money and manage their spending better, beginning by helping a widow.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit cottages in Cumbria and Cornwall, and a retail building in Wimbledon, south-west London, that are about to be sold at auction. After the sales they meet their new owners, then later find out how their plans for development have gone.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Cameras follow neighbourhood police in Weston-super-Mare as they crack down on crime with a series of raids.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report from Barcelona, where they find out how police are tackling the city's reputation as the pickpocket capital of Europe.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help two teams of couples find bargains at an antiques fair in the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, with Anita Manning overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from SW19, where the last-16 singles matches are scheduled to be the main attraction. Andy Murray recorded a 7-5, 6-1, 6-4 victory over the mercurial Nick Kyrgios at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament, in what was expected to be a much tougher encounter for the British number one. Meanwhile, Roger Federer faced little trouble as he defeated Steve Johnson in straight sets to also secure his passage to the next round, where he would go on to face Marin Cilic.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Mini Monet Millionaire
programme.desc: Martin Shaw narrates a profile of 14-year-old painter Kieron Williamson, who held his first show at the age of six and is already worth £2,000,000. With access to the Williamson household, this film follows Kieron's preparations for a major exhibition, revealing how his career is managed by his parents. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A concerned Karen pushes Bernadette to reveal the father's name, while Abi is put out when Steven rejects her and goes on to reveal what he heard Lauren saying about their relationship. The market traders are in uproar when Robbie evicts Donna from her pitch, and Denise quits her job as Pearl's nanny to take on her new job at the council - upsetting Kim in the process.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Britain's Food & Farming: The Brexit Effect - Panorama.
programme.desc: The EU dictates what farmers are allowed to grow, sets animal welfare standards and offers a large supply of cheap labour to work in the fields and processing plants. In this programme, Tom Heap talks to insiders who claim Brexit will mean higher prices, lower quality and less choice on the supermarket shelves, as well as others who believe it's a fantastic opportunity to address inefficiency and design a new mode of food production for the next generation. Will UK consumers back British farmers, or switch to potentially cheaper imports of hormone-filled meat from abroad?.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the retailers' attempts to outdo one another in terms of convenience - one of the fastest-growing battlegrounds. Gregg Wallace discovers how supermarkets decide where to open small stores, while Babita Sharma travels to Spain on the trail of easy peel fruit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director recalls an ambitious nationwide challenge for Comic Relief and discusses his involvement in an armed raid with chat show supremo Michael Parkinson. Featuring appearances by This Morning hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedians Kevin Bridges and Roisin Conaty joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's major issues.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores major new findings about Leonardo da Vinci's masterpiece, the Mona Lisa, as centuries-old documents are decoded and the latest optical, forensic, and historical tools and techniques are employed to reveal its secrets. Questions and mysteries surrounding the famous portrait - and the artist himself - are unravelled as art historians, authenticators, forensic specialists and academics attempt to get to the truth.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter U, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke bring unloved gardens back to life in a single day using clever design, imaginative ideas and recycling or re-use of existing plants and materials.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison meets a family making natural cordials and presses using their own elderflowers, before visiting Worcester Cathedral to catch a glimpse of its lesser horseshoe bats, thought to be the only urban population in the country. Adam Henson heads to the Peak District and explains why he has decided to send his beef cattle to an animal sanctuary in Norfolk rather than the slaughterhouse.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel's tour of the flavours of Britain takes him from a classic Lancashire hotpot to three melt-in-the-mouth one-pot dishes with origins from around the world. He meets Yasmin, whose fesenjoon takes her back to her childhood in Iran, gets a lesson in Brazil's national dish feijoada from brothers Andre and Anderson, and discovers the delicate flavours of a traditional Bangladeshi korma as he joins Enam and his family to celebrate Eid. Inspired by their dishes, Nigel creates a luxurious bean hotpot bejewelled with beetroot and carrot.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage from The Olympic Stadium in London, where the ninth meeting of the Diamond League campaign takes place. Coverage continues on BBC One.(n)

programme.title: The Great Caruso
programme.desc: Biopic of the acclaimed Italian operatic tenor Enrico Caruso, charting his progress from humble beginnings as a choirboy in Naples, to his difficult rise to fame in America, as he struggles to find acceptance before ultimately being recognised as one of the world's greatest singers. Starring Mario Lanza, Ann Blyth, Dorothy Kirsten and Jarmila Novotna.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Killer Whales: Beneath the Surface - Natural World.
programme.desc: A look at research into the lives of the marine mammals, which were long regarded as fearsome predators until the first one was brought into captivity for study in 1964, revealing facts about their profound intelligence, social interactions and parental instincts. The programme illustrates how contemporary studies continue to unearth revelations about the whales' behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms an old sofa, a gatepost and a canoe from a tip in Surrey, before selling them to try and make a profit for the people dumping them.(n)

programme.title: Rowing World Cup
programme.desc: Action from the third and final meeting of the season, which took place in Lucerne, Switzerland, and saw the British team looking to build on their success at round two in Poland. Matthew Pinsent presents, with analysis from Helen Glover, and commentary by James Cracknell and Gary Herbert.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Mark Stacey and Philip Serrell visit Greater Manchester, where items of interest include a ceramic tile, etchings by artist John Buckland-Wright and a gold necklace. Paul also interviews the great-granddaughter of suffragette Emmeline Pankhurst.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Engineers must construct and fit out a new station at Paddington and erect a great glass canopy to soar above the structure, while workers at Tottenham Court Road are building underground platforms and concourses the size of an aircraft carrier in the heart of the world's busiest shopping district. In Derby, a father and son team race to construct 66 trains to ferry passengers across the 30 miles of Crossrail line.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham examine the profit-making potential of more business plans, including an innovative form of nail gel, a toilet-flushing gadget for children, and a parking app from an entrepreneur whose company valuation stuns the panel. Hosted by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A Norwegian sheep farmer is finding the long hours and hard work of his demanding life are taking their toll. He trades places with a taxi driver from Devon who has dreams of running a farm, but fears the financial instability of giving up his job to pursue this goal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Foxcatcher
programme.desc: Premiere. A reclusive, eccentric millionaire persuades an Olympic gold-medal-winning wrestler to join his personal team. Initially flattered by the attention lavished upon him by his wealthy new friend, the fighter flourishes - but tension soon grows between them when his brother is employed as a coach, a situation that leads to tragedy. Fact-based drama, starring Steve Carell, Channing Tatum and Mark Ruffalo.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: In a bid to get back everything he has lost, his marriage, his livelihood and self-worth, Vincent concocts a spectacular plot to return to his rightful place, with the help of local gangster, Ronnie Farrell. But before that, he has to pay off his massive tax bill. Meanwhile, when Carol makes a simple mistake, Fitzpatrick and Lavender must help save the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Goob
programme.desc: A teenager spends every summer helping out in his mother's cafe and working on the harvest in the nearby pumpkin fields. The latest harvest season proves a very different one, as tension brews with his mother's new boyfriend and a flirtatious relationship with a foreign worker in the fields makes him consider a different future. Drama, starring Liam Walpole and Marama Corlett.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Burton-upon-Trent. The panel comprises Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg, Labour's Shadow Justice Secretary Richard Burgon, Green Party co-leader Caroline Lucas, Mirror columnist Susie Boniface and David Cameron's former director of communications Craig Oliver. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A grieving Morven won't accept the circumstances of a close tragedy and will stop at nothing to get the truth. Meanwhile, a familiar face arrives on Keller for emergency surgery, putting Sacha in a compromising personal and professional position. And when Nina makes her presence felt on Darwin, Matteo starts to see her in a new light.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former politician and Strictly star Ann Widdecombe tells Brian Conley about significant TV shows and characters from her past, including sailing soap Howards' Way, music and entertainment show Six-Five Special, Richard Chamberlain as Dr Kildare and 1960 biblical drama Paul of Tarsus.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team share some secrets on when damage definitely does not have to mean disaster. Plus, Adam Partridge reveals a hidden talent.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blue teams have the choice of two antique centres to buy three items to take to auction in Darlington. Eric also finds out about the city's long association with confectionery at its Castle Museum.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a woman's ashes.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day seven at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' fourth-round singles matches are due to get under way, while there is also a look back at some of the greatest moments at SW19, on what is the 90th anniversary of the BBC's first radio coverage of the Grand Slam. Agnieszka Radwanska was the highest-seeded casualty in the ladies draw on this day last year, as she fell to a 6-3, 5-7, 9-7 defeat to the number 19 seed, Dominika Cibulkova. That match was not the only epic encounter to take place on court number three, as Russia's Elena Vesnina battled to a 5-7, 6-1, 9-7 triumph over her compatriot Ekaterina Makarova, to set up a quarter-final against Dominika Cibulkova. Over on centre court, eventual champion Serena Williams recorded a fairly one-sided 7-5, 6-0 win over Svetlana Kuznetsova, while perhaps the standout contest of the day saw Simona Halep face Madison Keys on Number One court, with the former eventually coming out on top by a score of 6-7, 6-4, 6-3.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the seventh day's play, where the line-up for the quarter-finals in the singles draws was set to be decided. While the men to emerge victorious know that they are in line for a rest day ahead of their last-eight encounters, the ladies will have a quick turnaround and be back in action tomorrow, so Clare and her guests will also preview those matches.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Thatcher finds Robin and puts the boy into the care of Reid, Jackson and Long Susan, who manage to uncover information that they hope may lead them to Nathaniel. They arrive at the Sumner house only to discover it has been cleaned and the two bodies disposed of. Shine turns up and is surprised to learn of the true identity of the killer and heads of to confront Augustus Dove about his brother, but the assistant commissioner manages to persuade Shine that Reid is the bigger threat. Matthew Macfadyen stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Theresa v Boris: How May Became PM
programme.desc: Docu-drama telling the story of the Conservative Party's 2016 leadership campaign, from the day David Cameron resigned to the day Theresa May became Prime Minister. Based on exhaustive research and first-person testimonies, this dramatised narrative goes beyond the headlines to lay bare the politicking and positioning, betrayals and blunders of this extraordinary political time. The programme also features key interviews with people who were intimately involved in the campaigns of the main contenders.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Ballet: Woolf Works
programme.desc: A performance from the Royal Opera House of Wayne McGregor's ballet inspired by the works of Virginia Woolf. The production's three acts are each themed around one of Woolf's novels - Mrs Dalloway, Orlando and The Waves - while also drawing on her letters, essays and diaries. Introduced by Darcey Bussell and Clemency Burton-Hill.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Volcanoes have long helped shape the Earth, but what is less well known is that there are volcanoes on other planets and moons that are even more extraordinary than those on our own home planet. Cameras follow a team of volcanologists in Iceland as they draw parallels with the volcanoes on Earth and those elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock and Chris Lintott report on the presence of trans-Neptunian objects, a large number of minor planets on the edge of the solar system, many with moons of their own and unusual orbits. Plus, Marcus du Sautoy reveals how the mathematical study of these objects may increase our understanding of how the solar system was created.(n)

programme.title: Destination Titan
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of a British team involved in preparing the European Space Agency's Huygens probe for its two-billion-mile journey to Saturn's largest moon, a voyage that took seven years. The film explores the sacrifices involved in the project, and the scientists talk about their hopes for the probe, and thoughts on its successful landing in 2005.(n)

programme.title: The Search for Life: The Drake Equation
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell visits scientists around the world who have researched different aspects of Dr Frank Drake's equation. Formulated in the 1960s, it was intended to determine where to point one of the radio telescopes at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory in Virginia in a bid to detect extraterrestrial life. Despite the calculation of a possible 50,000 civilisations being able to communicate across the galaxy, no signals were received - but the project focused on other questions about the universe.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: How the growth of phytoplankton along the coastal waters of Alaska and British Columbia attracts a vast array of marine life to feast on billions of herring. Footage includes humpback whales migrating from Hawaii as well as Steller sea lions, dolphins and killer whales that make the long and arduous journey toward the abundant fish, risking malnutrition and attacks from predators along the way. Narrated by David Attenborough. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Ballet: Woolf Works
programme.desc: A performance from the Royal Opera House of Wayne McGregor's ballet inspired by the works of Virginia Woolf. The production's three acts are each themed around one of Woolf's novels - Mrs Dalloway, Orlando and The Waves - while also drawing on her letters, essays and diaries. Introduced by Darcey Bussell and Clemency Burton-Hill.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Oakham in Rutland, where he learns about a noble tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and decides to take part. Heading east to Stamford, Lincolnshire, he discovers why the town is such an attractive location for period dramas, while a ghoulish scene awaits in Peterborough when he visits a Victorian operating theatre where railwaymen were treated. Michael's last stop on his journey is Christ's College at Cambridge University, where he finds out about the student days of Charles Darwin. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili continues his investigation into scientific methods originating from the Islamic world with a trip to Northern Syria, where he learns about Al-Biruni, the astronomer and mathematician who, 1,000 years ago, estimated the size of Earth to within a few hundred miles of the correct figure. He also visits Cairo to explore physicist Ibn al-Haytham's contribution to the modern science of optics.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: This Was My Dad: The Rise and Fall of Geoffrey Matthews - Storyville.
programme.desc: Film-maker Morgan Matthews' documentary charts 10 years in the life of his father Geoff, following him through a financial crisis and the onset of emphysema and cancer.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 528.
