programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. Meanwhile, an emotionally shaken McGee struggles with the ramifications of the incident. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. Bishop reveals her past association with the quarry and suggests where she thinks he may be found, but the CIA has intercepted a call that places Parsa in a different location to Ellie's hunch. Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects a blogger's fascination with serial killers may have led him to commit murder in an attempt to achieve a twisted kind of fame. Unfortunately the FBI takes over the case before he can gather enough evidence to make an arrest, prompting him to try another strategy. Aware that the suspect craves publicity, he arranges for him to appear on a TV talk show. Directed by and starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to a nightclub car park where an undercover policewoman has been shot, and discovers she was trying to obtain incriminating evidence against a drug kingpin - whose henchmen later kidnap him. His only chance of escape lies in playing a psychological game with the dead woman's partner, who appears to have begun to identify with her underworld contacts so closely that she has changed sides and become a criminal.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A former American football star's assistant dies in a car bomb, which Jane believes was intended for the sportsman, so he sets up a ruse to make the killer believe the attack was successful and the athlete is dead. The team compiles a list of suspects and tries to draw out the criminal at a memorial service, but the investigators uncover a long list of enemies with different motives. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to the scene of a fireman's death, but is knocked unconscious while searching for the murder weapon and almost drowns in a pond, which causes him to lose his memory and revert to his former con-artist self. Rigsby takes him under his wing, convinced the only way to get him firing on all cylinders again is to bring him back into the CBI fold. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A lawyer is killed in an explosion on his boat, leaving the team to find out that he was accused of cheating by a mob boss, so Cho goes undercover at one of the criminal's gaming nights to see what he can learn. Back at CBI headquarters, FBI Agent Darcy has been assigned to re-examine the case of serial killer Panzer, but Jane believes her life is in danger when Red John sends them doctored footage of her. Crime drama, guest starring Catherine Dent and Rudolf Martin, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The team tackles jury bias against a woman on trial for the murder of a star athlete, who she previously accused of assaulting her. Meanwhile, Benny encounters an old flame.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb plot is uncovered following a death at a Quantico reunion, and tensions in the squad room cause trouble for Torres and Quinn as they settle into their new jobs.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine sergeant falls to her death from a building, and when Gibbs and his team examine the circumstances, the woman's doctor urges him to consider this a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: Shots Fired
programme.desc: Tensions are on the rise at Gate Station, as a violent riot erupts, bringing the citizens and the police into conflict. Crime drama, starring Sanaa Lathan and Stephan James.(n)

programme.title: Baskets
programme.desc: Chip finds himself in a reflective mood, and laments the moment Ronald Reagan gave up his acting career for a desk job - in the Oval Office.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns about phone apps and his newly acquired enthusiasm soon sees his phone overloaded. He buys a new mobile with greater memory and gives his old one to Chris, which sets in motion a series of horrible events leading to his son being branded a sex offender and sent on a rehab course.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Hayley experiences the hardships of pregnancy when Roger agrees to `give birth' to Jeff to make him human again. Meanwhile, Snot is offended when Steve signs him up for a makeover.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes Steve's legal guardian, but his overzealous approach to parenting gets his adopted son's school principal fired. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine decide to make their own fun at the world's biggest water park.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter realises Chris is utterly irresponsible, and tries to rectify matters by getting him a job at the local golf course, hoping he will benefit from being entrusted with regular adult duties. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is awarded a prestigious job as a sniffer dog for the Quahog police department, only to suffer the embarrassment of becoming addicted to cocaine and referred to a rehabilitation clinic.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths are unaware Roger plans to become `king of spring break' by inviting students to party at their home. Meanwhile, Steve tries to lose his virginity and Stan is attracted to a vivacious new friend.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: On Roger's 1,600th birthday, Steve announces he is going through puberty. With Hayley's transition still fresh in the memory, Stan plots to avert any trouble caused by his son's raging hormones.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brian moves into his cousin Jasper's Hollywood apartment and tries to start a career in screenwriting. Things are slow taking off, and he spends some time washing cars and working as a waiter to make ends meet. When his break finally comes, it is not quite what he had in mind.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter becomes the president of a cigarette company that uses toy products to promote smoking among children. Lois initially urges him to take a stand against the policy - but the perks of his new job soon persuade her to drop her opposition.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: One If by Clam, Two If by Sea.
programme.desc: A hurricane sweeps through Quahog and damages the Drunken Clam - which is then bought at a knock-down price by an opportunistic expat Brit who angers the locals by turning it into an English-themed pub. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to teach the new landlord's three-year-old daughter how to speak proper English.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg tries to get friendly with the in-crowd at school, but becomes the target of their cruel mockery. Peter competes against Chris in a variety of winter pursuits, including a skating race and the unusual `kitchenware on face and head' contest - but there is a surprise in store for him.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger believes his identity has been stolen when his credit card unexpectedly reaches its limit, and sets out to catch the criminal. However, after a few days of playing detective, he realises things are not quite what they seem. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Wendy Schaal.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan gets a new position as his boss's adviser and is delighted to accommodate his every request. However, the job begins to threaten his personal life and Francine is roped in to help complete an outrageous task, ruining her plans to spend Valentine's Day with her husband.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Adrian suspects a kung-fu film star of murdering his biographer - but the man is ruled out of Stottlemeyer's investigation by evidence suggesting he died six years previously. Mystery drama, guest starring Mako (Samurai Jack), with Tony Shalhoub and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to the scene of a fireman's death, but is knocked unconscious while searching for the murder weapon and almost drowns in a pond, which causes him to lose his memory and revert to his former con-artist self. Rigsby takes him under his wing, convinced the only way to get him firing on all cylinders again is to bring him back into the CBI fold. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A lawyer is killed in an explosion on his boat, leaving the team to find out that he was accused of cheating by a mob boss, so Cho goes undercover at one of the criminal's gaming nights to see what he can learn. Back at CBI headquarters, FBI Agent Darcy has been assigned to re-examine the case of serial killer Panzer, but Jane believes her life is in danger when Red John sends them doctored footage of her. Crime drama, guest starring Catherine Dent and Rudolf Martin, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The FBI's investigation into the death of Van Pelt's fiance comes to an end, just in time for her to help investigate the murder of a mob boss's son, who was killed while celebrating the prospect of taking control of the business from his ailing father. While Jane and the others focus their inquiries on the rest of the crime family, Grace takes the only witness in for interrogation, but is distracted by her own problems, and forced into a game of cat-and-mouse against a determined assassin. Drama, starring Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and Lisbon investigate the murder of an out-of-favour fashion designer who was planning to revitalise his career by launching a new clothing line, but first have to track down the man employed to make the outfits. Darcy continues to re-examine the Panzer case, talking to a blind woman who was friends with Red John - only for her to reveal the serial killer is still alive. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Brenda and her team to solve the murder of a police detective, but as evidence points to one of their own, the Deputy Police Chief struggles to match DNA samples that could prove their case. However, it becomes clear Gabriel and Daniels' relationship to the victim is key to understanding the crime. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When a juror dies during the trial of a Mob boss, Brenda has her work cut out questioning the remainder of the jury, while an unannounced visit puts her plans with Fritz on hold. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murders of three college students, apparently caught in the middle of a gang shootout. It transpires that one of the youngsters was the son of people known to Taylor. The detective also tries to keep her relationship with Fritz under wraps while her mother remains in town. Detective drama, with Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Gossett and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda's 40th birthday approaches, she investigates the high-profile case of a woman who was murdered at one of Los Angeles' trendiest restaurants. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. Bishop reveals her past association with the quarry and suggests where she thinks he may be found, but the CIA has intercepted a call that places Parsa in a different location to Ellie's hunch. Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo confronts a man impersonating a Navy officer, which results in guns being drawn, and the only eyewitness to the case is the Special Agent's father - who is in town to disclose a secret to his son. The 250th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb detonates at a military charity concert, killing two men. Called to investigate, Tony and McGee try to determine whether the intended target was the 1980s rocker headlining the act or if the attack was part of a larger scheme against the military. Meanwhile, Jimmy prepares for parenthood. Keith Carradine guest stars, with Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian's luck as a writer changes dramatically when Stewie becomes his manager, and one of his books hits the bestseller list. However, fame soon goes to his head, and it takes a wake-up call from satirist Bill Maher to bring him to his senses. Comedy, featuring the voices of Mila Kunis and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter suffers kidney failure after drinking kerosene and is told he needs a transplant. Luckily, Brian is a match and offers one of his, but concerns are raised that a canine organ might not be suitable. Meanwhile, Meg and Chris collaborate on a poem for an important visitor.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan creates attractive alter ego Phyllis in a desperate bid to bond with his son, but when he takes things too far, Francine is forced to intervene. Elsewhere, a group of men takes advantage of Roger's new limousine service, prompting him to set out on a manhunt to exact revenge. With the guest voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A jealous Francine tries to break up Stan's renewed relationship with a former girlfriend, only to unwittingly leave Roger at the mercy of an alien-hunter. Elsewhere, Steve accidentally wears Hayley's panties to school, and finds they bring him luck.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is struck by lightning and hovers on the brink of death. In his state of limbo he experiences flashbacks that make him realise he should pay more attention to his beloved wife. At the same time, he agrees to arrange a date for Death with the girl from the pet shop. Peter Frampton guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Whacked Out Sports
programme.desc: Generally telecast on the weekend late-night schedule, the half-hour Whacked Out Sports was a reality "clip" show devoted to unusual sports activities and embarrassing bloopers. The series' specialty seemed to be spotlighting eccentric contestants indulging in offbeat sports events with bizarre rules. In each market that the series played, viewers were invited to send in video clips of "crazy stuff never seen on TV" -- especially if "hot girls" were involved (that's what it said on the press release!). programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moaning Lisa. Lisa Simpson (voice of Yeardley Smith) is used to being a misfit, but one day she finds herself overcome by feelings of depression, and nothing she does seems to make her feel better. Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) is concerned, but can't seem to figure out what the matter is, and urges her daughter to ignore her feelings and put on a happy face. Lisa, however, makes friends with local jazz musician Bleeding Gums Murphy (voice of Ron Taylor), who shows her how to work out her bad feelings by playing the blues. Marge, however, isn't so sure that playing blues riffs will really help Lisa in the long run. Meanwhile, Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) has problems with Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), who has been subjecting Homer to a series of "defeats -- correction, humiliating defeats" on their video boxing game; Homer is convinced he has to start winning if he wants to regain the respect of his son. "Moaning Lisa" first aired on February 11, 1990(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the Daredevil. Timing is the watchword for the Simpson family when Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) and Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) learn that the Springfield Speedway will be staging a special thrill-show the same night as Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) will be performing a solo in the school band concert. The moment the concert is over, Homer and Bart rush Lisa and Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) into the car, just in time for their car to nearly be swallowed up by Truckasaurus, a robot made from several monster trucks. As part of the show, Bart watches famous daredevil Capt. Lance Murdock (voice of Castellaneta) jump his motorcycle over a tank filled with hungry sharks and man-eating lions. Impressed, Bart begins jumping his skateboard over an increasingly large number of objects, even after an injury earns him a stern warning from Dr. Hibbert (voice of Harry Shearer). Bart decides he needs to stage a truly impressive stunt, and he makes plans to leap over Springfield Gorge; when Homer finds out, he has to find a way to stop his son before he hurts himself. "Bart the Daredevil" first aired on December 6, 1990(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa the Greek. Homer and Lisa start spending every Sunday together, with Lisa predicting the football results and Homer getting rich betting on the games. But does he just want her for the money?(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Duffless. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) and his alcoholic friend Barney Gumble (also voiced by Castellaneta) sneak out of work and take a tour of the Duff Brewery, where they help themselves to the copious free samples of Duff Beer, Duff Lite, Duff Dry, Duff Dark, and Raspberry Duff. On his way home, Homer gets picked up for drunk driving, causing him to lose his license and to attend Alc-Anon meetings under a court order. He pledges to give up drinking for thirty days, in part to get his license back and in part to please Marge (voice of Julie Kavner), who is worried about Homer's fondness for alcohol. But Homer finds that going a month without beer is harder than he expected. Meanwhile, after Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) destroys a giant tomato that Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) was growing for a science fair project, she gets an idea for a new project -- an experiment in which she'll prove an ordinary hamster is smarter than her brother. Duffless was first aired on February 18, 1993(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge on the Lam. Marge's wild night out with neighbour Ruth (Pamela Reed) includes running from the police in Ruth's car, stolen from her ex(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart's Girlfriend. Bart acquires a new girlfriend, but has he taken on more than he can handle? Featuring the guest voice of Meryl Streep(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the Fink. Bart inadvertently causes the death of his hero - Krusty the clown. Featuring the guest voice of Bob Newhart as himself(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Brother From Another Series. Murderous convict Sideshow Bob (Kelsey Grammer) is released to work for his brother Cecil (David Hyde Pierce), whom Bob bested at the Krusty-sidekick audition(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpson Tide. Because of Homer's nuclear experience, he is assigned to a nuclear submarine. During a war game exercise, the Captain leaves Homer in charge; Homer makes some bad decisions and nearly starts a war(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Viva Ned Flanders. Seeking more fun out of life, Flanders asks for help from Homer, who takes him to Las Vegas. The Moody Blues have a cameo(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Mansion Family. While house-sitting for Burns (who's getting a checkup at the Mayo Clinic), Homer throws a party aboard the billionaire's yacht in international waters---where anything goes. Britney Spears is a guest voice(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Great Money Caper. Homer and Bart become scam artists when the family is faced with the cost of a sudden car repair. Featuring the special guest voice of Ed Norton(n)

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
programme.desc: A lonely, recently divorced teacher has an affair with a much-younger man. However, their relationship takes a terrifying turn as he grows obsessed with her(n)

programme.title: The Great St Trinian's Train Robbery
programme.desc: A crook and his cronies stash the money from a train heist in a deserted old mansion, planning to recover it in good time. However, several years later, when the thieves arrive to collect their loot, they discover the building has been turned into a school for girls where the pupils have become infamous for their escapades. Comedy, starring Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, Reg Varney and George Cole.(n)

programme.title: The Phantom
programme.desc: A jungle-dwelling masked adventurer leaves his African home for New York in a bid to stop the power-crazed schemes of an evil industrialist. The tycoon is on the hunt for three legendary magical skulls, which can be combined to form the ultimate weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Billy Zane, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Treat Williams and Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: A girl grows up in 16th-century Europe under the iron fist of her stepmother, until the love of handsome Prince Henry offers a glimmer of hope. Unfortunately, the royal gent has worries of his own in the shape of an arranged marriage. Luckily, Renaissance genius Leonardo da Vinci is on hand to play fairy godfather and bring the pair together. Romantic drama, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston, Dougray Scott and Timothy West.(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Words
programme.desc: A spiritual guru decides to teach his lying literary agent a lesson for his dishonesty, and places a curse on him. The spell means he can only speak another 1,000 words in his life - and when the words run out, he will die. The only way to break the enchantment is to put right all his past mistakes. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: Europa Report
programme.desc: Premiere. A privately funded spaceship with an international crew is sent to investigate the potential of Jupiter's fourth largest moon to support life, but technical glitches and human error plunge the astronauts into extreme danger. Found footage sci-fi thriller, starring Daniel Wu, Sharlto Copley and Michael Nyqvist.(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A colony of super-intelligent apes thrives following a global virus outbreak that wipes out much of the human race. A survivor tries to make peace with the leader of the apes, but their efforts to reach an understanding are threatened by warmongers on both sides. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Jason Clarke and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Ones
programme.desc: An academic scientist recruits a group of Oxford students for a strange experiment, performing a series of tests on a woman in the hope of tapping into her apparent psychic abilities and deliberately manifesting a poltergeist. However, they soon find they are unable to control the dark forces they unleash. Horror, starring Jared Harris and Sam Claflin.(n)

programme.title: To the Wonder
programme.desc: An American tourist in Paris falls in love with a French single mother, and hastily marries her before bringing her home with him to Oklahoma. As their passion cools, they each seek solace in relationships with others - she turns to a fellow immigrant, a priest who is losing his faith, while her husband is reunited with an old flame. Terrence Malick's drama, starring Ben Affleck, Olga Kurylenko, Rachel McAdams and Javier Bardem.(n)

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.desc: Documentary that follows the Deafinitely Theatre as it translates A Midsummer Night's Dream into BSL and prepares for a career defining performance at Shakespeare's Globe.(n)

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Ford's Western, with John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Terror By Night
programme.desc: The legendary sleuth and his faithful sidekick Dr Watson hunt for the killer of an aristocrat who hired them to keep a priceless diamond out of the hands of thieves. Mystery, starring Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Alan Mowbray, Dennis Hoey and Mary Forbes.(n)

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: An alcoholic former professional player reluctantly agrees to train an all-female baseball team during the Second World War. With star player Dottie Hinson and her sister Kit on board, they look set to dominate the league - until sibling rivalry rears its head. Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: First Class
programme.desc: Telepathic mutant Charles Xavier forms the first generation of the superhero team in the 1960s. Their battle with a Nazi war criminal manipulating the world toward nuclear war gradually drives a wedge between Xavier and his ally Magneto, leading them to become deadly enemies. Superhero adventure prequel, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Nymphomaniac: Volume I
programme.desc: A woman is found beaten in an alley by a stranger, who brings her home. She spends the night with him, and recounts the story of her sexual history and the darker experiences her search for satisfaction has led to. Part one of Lars von Trier's two-part drama, starring Charlotte Gainsbourg, Stellan Skarsgard and Stacy Martin.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares raspberry shortcakes.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares a roast beef and horseradish sandwich for lunch.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten helps a bride-to be who is having problems planning her rehearsal dinner. She prepares two desserts while Miguel Flores-Vianna designs two table settings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Running a store isn't easy, and Ina should know - she ran a deli for 20 years. Ina suggests a French-inspired menu of Provencal soup, seafood and coconut madeleines for dessert as a staff thank you.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter on the ranch starts with a Good Friday delivery of hot cross buns to friends. Ree makes tortellini primavera and 'krispy' eggs, with a basket of crudites and a spinach dip.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the family works cattle, Ree Drummond fills the freezer with components ready to turn into meals at a moment's notice.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Dinner Through the Decades.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond confesses about her life on a plate, from beef stroganoff that she loved as a child of the 70s, to pasta ai quattro formaggi that defined her student life in LA.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: The chef continues his campaign to improve the diets of the people of Rotherham. Jamie's pupils struggle to apply their new cooking skills to their home lives, and he attends a Rotherham United football match to show that even the most unlikely of people can take part in his culinary revolution - including a local miner who has never prepared a meal in his life.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The agents make a disastrous mistake during a mission, but a college lecturer helps to salvage the situation.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity causes mayhem when a Russian hitman is sent after the wrong target.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Miraculous Curing of Old Goff Helliwell.
programme.desc: When Clegg, Billy and Truly hear an old school friend is about to die, the trio search for something - or someone - to put the spark back into his life. Comedy, guest starring Henry McGee, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Keith Clifford.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville arranges a double date with Madge and Mavis for himself and Gastric - but has to smarten his friend up first. Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a potential new husband, Nurse Gladys is wooed by a man whose boil she once treated, while Eric and Cyril need to come up with some clever marketing ideas when a mysterious new product arrives in the shop.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The neighbourhood prepares for a wedding, and Granville gets into the spirit of things by putting up a large display to bring a bit of cheeriness to his shop window. However, the reluctant groom has cold feet, and it falls to the miserly shopkeeper to ensure he makes it to the church on time. The marital atmosphere also has a marked effect on Mrs Featherstone, who steps up her search for a fourth husband - with Granville and Mr Newbold finding themselves likely candidates to be the next lucky man.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell some damaged tins of chilli beans and prove the erotic power of salami, but finds himself confronted with a customer's unhappy husband. Cyril and Eric seek advice on how to impress their wives, while Mrs Featherstone's efforts to secure Mr Newbold as a fourth husband suffer a setback.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels, and the only way to discover their contents is to open them. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear.
programme.desc: Arkwright's regular customers are upset by his habit of continually dragging Granville around by the ear in an attempt to toughen him up. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A man who emigrated to Australia decades earlier, and was known to have a soft spot for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, plans to pay a return visit to his former haunts - making Arkwright fear that he will try to rekindle old passions. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville and Gastric try to get Madge into the festive spirit by organising a cosy drinks party. Meanwhile, a bargain Christmas tree causes problems, Nurse Gladys discusses tactics for her new job with Mrs Featherstone and Eric and Cyril attempt to impress their wives with a healthy living plan. Christmas edition of the comedy, starring David Jason, Lynda Baron and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville organises a cut-price sale - but only as a means to get rid of old stock - while Nurse Gladys is reunited with a former patient. Romance is in the air in the neighbourhood, as Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a new arrival while Mavis tries to reignite Granville's passion over a cup of coffee.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville discovers a gap in the shop's security, and Madge is made anxious by a cherry picker - while a neighbour's home cooking threatens the penny-pinching shopkeeper's plans to matchmake her and Gastric. Meanwhile, Eric and Kath make plans to spend some time together.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville arranges a double date with Madge and Mavis for himself and Gastric - but has to smarten his friend up first. Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a potential new husband, Nurse Gladys is wooed by a man whose boil she once treated, while Eric and Cyril need to come up with some clever marketing ideas when a mysterious new product arrives in the shop.(n)

programme.desc: The neighbourhood prepares for a wedding, and Granville gets into the spirit of things by putting up a large display to bring a bit of cheeriness to his shop window. However, the reluctant groom has cold feet, and it falls to the miserly shopkeeper to ensure he makes it to the church on time. The marital atmosphere also has a marked effect on Mrs Featherstone, who steps up her search for a fourth husband - with Granville and Mr Newbold finding themselves likely candidates to be the next lucky man.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell some damaged tins of chilli beans and prove the erotic power of salami, but finds himself confronted with a customer's unhappy husband. Cyril and Eric seek advice on how to impress their wives, while Mrs Featherstone's efforts to secure Mr Newbold as a fourth husband suffer a setback.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary yields to pressure from Dorothy and reluctantly agrees to hire a cleaner. Tony's efforts to make Deborah jealous meet with little success, until he hits on the idea of pretending to have another girlfriend - but does not know where he will find anyone gullible enough to play the part.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary proposes to Dorothy while drunk, and is forced to resort to desperate measures to stay single. Tony plants listening device in Deborah's flat to find out what she sees in her boyfriend. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes and Neil Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Successful West End actor Tony Warner's tour-de-force performance as Macbeth is the toast of the Duke of Cambridge Theatre, but his overbearing personality makes life hell for his fellow thespians. It would be very bad luck indeed if he was suddenly indisposed in some way - although not for Jim, his ever-hopeful understudy. Comedy, starring Reece Shearsmith, Steve Pemberton, Lyndsey Marshal and Julia Davis.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Siblings Hector and Tabitha live in a carefully refrigerated gothic mansion and seldom go out, but a special event means that a babysitter is required to look after their bedridden, elderly brother Andras. For Katy, the offer of £88 for an evening's work is too good to turn down. Starring Reece Shearsmith, Helen McCrory and Aimee-Ffion Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern: Death of Rock.
programme.desc: The host concludes his guide with a look at the various causes of band splits, including drink, drugs and `creative differences'. He also profiles a selection of rock stars who are focused on saving the world, and examines the state of contemporary music. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day and featuring cameo performances by John Humphrys and Peter Gabriel.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: Brian Pern: A Life in Rock.
programme.desc: Spoof documentary about the former frontman of a progressive rock group, last seen presenting a history of music in BBC Four's The Life of Rock. In the opening episode, Brian and his Thotch bandmates reunite to discuss the making of a musical based on their songs, but it is not easy as they hate each other. Not only that, on the opening night of Stowe Boys, Brian is unexpectedly arrested by officers from Operation Bad Apples for a crime he doesn't know he has committed. Will he make the second half of the show? Written by Rhys Thomas and Simon Day, who also stars as Pern, with Michael Kitchen, Paul Whitehouse and Nigel Havers.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Dee Dee is astounded by the wonders of Teletext, and TV psychic Raymond Day puts a member of his studio audience back in touch with a deceased boyfriend. Elsewhere, Limmy speculates on what it would be like to be brilliant at everything, and bumps into an over-friendly old acquaintance. Sketch show, starring Brian Limond.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: A tramp falls in love with a heart-shaped balloon, a 1960s pop star tries to make a comeback, Jacqueline treats herself to dinner at a fancy restaurant, and a caller flirts with Falconhoof. Elsewhere, Limmy shows off his spoon-playing skills. Sketch show, starring Brian Limond.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The bungling spy has to stop Lewis and Dexter from infiltrating a group of animal activists.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A top secret device goes missing, and the bungling spy is teamed up with a brash American agent to recover it.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. The first episode of the sitcom, starring Richard Briers as an obsessive middle-aged man who yearns to be at the centre of his local suburban neighbourhood. With Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast in 1984.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: A new manager arrives at the recently built Whitbury leisure centre - but things get off to a shaky start when he selects a poolside attendant who cannot swim. First episode of the comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels, and the only way to discover their contents is to open them. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: The Songs of Praise crew visits Dibley to record a programme in the village church. However, when Geraldine develops a crush on the producer her wayward emotions threaten to plunge the proceedings into disaster. Comedy, guest starring Peter Capaldi (The Thick of It).(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith suddenly becomes impressed by Lionel, while Alistair tries to woo Jean with a band and a gorillagram. Comedy, starring Judi Dench.(n)

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: The first episode of the award-winning comedy, starring Ricky Gervais. Admin manager David Brent is ordered to raise staff morale, just as head office starts dropping ominous hints about upcoming redundancies. With Martin Freeman. Lucy Davis and Mackenzie Crook.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Hal Cruttenden hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Justin Moorhouse and Tom Stade take the mic.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Sophie tells Mark she and Jeff are moving in together, and the blow is compounded when she reveals she has been asked her to spend less time with him. Meanwhile, Jeremy becomes concerned about how his glum friend is coping with depression. Starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Penang, Malaysia, to sample its multifaceted cuisine, which includes Malay, Indian, Chinese and British flavours. He also meets food writer Fay Khoo to explore the popularity of the region's fish-head curry, before crossing the Indian Ocean to Sri Lanka, where he visits a bustling fishing village and takes part in an unusual expedition.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The seafood chef continues to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures with a visit to Sri Lanka, where he discovers a wealth of hot and spicy vegetable curries. He then ventures on to Bali and finds food has a religious significance on the island, before sampling what he believes is the best roast pork he has ever tasted.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef ends his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures by visiting Bangladesh, sampling the curry on offer in the country that has played a major role in establishing the success of Indian restaurants throughout the UK.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Spring arrives at the farm, bringing 11 new piglets and a pair of lambs. Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall hunts for morel mushrooms, which he plans to use in a terrine to enter in a competition for the best picnic. He also gets a lesson in bread-making from a master baker, and hopes to sell the end results at the local cider festival.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall investigates the possibility of installing beehives at the farm - but his fear of being stung proves a stumbling block. He also takes on the challenge of providing the catering for a 70-strong wedding party who only want to be served wild or home-grown produce.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall teams up with a fisherman from Lyme Regis to catch whelks and cook them for sale on Dorset's beaches on carnival day. He also plans an event to celebrate the success of his tomato crop, complete with a ketchup-making contest and an unusual new flavour of ice-cream.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall collects the first crop of honey from his hives, enlisting the help of an apiarist to avoid being stung, and enrolling in bee-keeping classes to get more out of his harvest. He also takes a steer to slaughter, and tries to improve the reputation of tripe with the general public at the local farmers' market.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall plans a menu for an autumn feast, featuring young cockerels as the main course - but has difficulty working out which chicks are the males. He also enlists the help of a local potter in creating chicken bricks, to ensure the meat turns out tender, and goes on a hunt for the last wild mushrooms of the season.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts his early days as a smallholder, beginning with his arrival in Dorset, where he soon learned the importance of knowing the locals who now supply him with food for his table. Also featured are several of the recipes Hugh conjures up, including watercress and wild garlic soup.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls the development of his horticultural skills in Dorset, from the planting of his first organic vegetable patches to harvesting bumper crops from his polytunnels, and offers tips on how to come out on top at the local agricultural show.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Smallholder Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates his love of pigs and pork, guiding viewers through every stage of his dealings with his sows, from how to buy a pig to how to cure the meat. Also featured is Hugh's beloved breeding sow Delia.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four chefs who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to make creme patissiere and use it as a base for a souffle. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's dish of lamb kidneys in a three-mustard sauce with a Savoyard potato cake, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining amateur bakers face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by preparing two varieties of flatbread for judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. The hopefuls then tackle a demanding technical challenge as they try to replicate Paul's recipe for an eight-strand plaited loaf, before receiving the dubious honour of becoming the first contestants in the show's history to make bagels. At the end of the day, Paul and Mary must decide who is this round's Star Baker - and who will be going home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final heat sees the last new group of amateur cooks competing for a place in tomorrow's quarter-final. As usual, they begin by showing off their culinary skills with a single plate of food, before rustling up a dish in the invention test from either the sweet box, containing pineapple, white chocolate, digestives, pecan nuts, creme fraiche and sherry, or the savoury box, which has rabbit, smoked haddock, bacon, curly kale, vine tomatoes, baby turnips and leeks inside. After two hopefuls are shown the door, the rest cook a two-course meal for three guests - 2009 MasterChef champion Mat Follas, as well as previous finalists Andy Oliver and Tom Whitaker - before Gregg Wallace and John decide who will progress in the contest.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate Britain's love of seafood and the plentiful and diverse supply of produce obtained from local waters. They also explore the history of Billingsgate Market in east London, the country's largest inland fish market.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.(n)

English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John..(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar-winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard (Gerald Launbeau) at the same time as he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)
