programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Insecure as F**k. Two black women who are best friends navigate the pitfalls of their personal and professional lives in south Los Angeles in this comedy, which begins with Issa wondering if her relationship with her boyfriend is still worth the effort, while Molly's success as an attorney barely masks her dissatisfaction with her romantic prospects(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Troubled psychologist George Clooney is sent to investigate the crew of an isolated research station orbiting a bizarre planet(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A parody of the much-done medieval English tale of Robin Hood and his Merry Men, ROBIN HOOD: MEN IN TIGHTS also directly lampoons the politically correct ROBIN HOOD: PRINCE OF THIEVES, which starred the hearthrob of the time, the very un-British Kevin Costner. English hearthrob Cary Elwes gets a turn in the role of the hero of Sherwood Forest who robs from the rich to give to the poor when he returns from the Crusades to find his beloved King Richard usurped by the evil Prince John..(n)

programme.title: Hitchcock/Truffaut
programme.desc: In this in-depth documentary, filmmakers discuss the impact of Francois Truffaut's 1966 book "Hitchcock/Truffaut," in which Alfred Hitchcock painstakingly detailed his directorial process(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Drama based on the life and career of the young Mexican-American singer who was murdered just as she was on the verge of crossing over from the Tejano pop scene to the mainstream. From her early start to her success at 17, the film follows Selena's progress, until she was shot by the woman who ran her fan club(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The gun-toting treasure seeker is thrown into a furious battle with a mysterious secret society as she races against time to locate the missing pieces of the Triangle of Light, a legendary artefact that grants the owner the ability to control time(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Reports on the day's newsworthy events from around the world(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse. After the resurrected villain recruits four superpowered followers, Professor X and his charges attempt to stop them(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar-winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard (Gerald Launbeau) at the same time as he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: The diary of a green Vietnam GI shows the realities of that conflict as soldiers fight enemies, including bugs, C-rations, jungle rot, marijuana and a demoralized sergeant, as well as the Vietcong(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: A lonely writer begins a relationship with his hyper- intelligent computer operating system(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.sub-title: Love Is the Weapon of Choice
programme.desc: Love Is the Weapon of Choice. Bret and Jemaine become rivals for the attentions of the same woman, who happens to have an epileptic dog that has gone missing(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this wildly entertaining sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. However, the mogul soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick Marshall, Playboy and hot shot in advertising, thinks he's God's gift to women. After an accident however, he discovers that he is suddenly able to her what women really think. Nick decides to sabotage his new boss by reading her thoughts and selling her ideas as his own, but unfortunately love gets in his way(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: The story of two best friends, Rafe and Danny, and their love lives as they go off to join the war(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A self-help author comes home for a visit and finds his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher in this crude farce(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 161. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock(n)

programme.title: Suited
programme.desc: A look at a tailoring company in Brooklyn that provides custom attire for LGBTQ clients features profiles of the owners and the diverse community they serve. Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner ("Girls") are producers(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Two bumbling store clerks inadvertently erase the footage from all of the tapes in their video rental store. In order to keep the business running, they re-shoot every film in the store with their own camera, with a budget of zero dollars(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. Based on true events(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: A structural engineer (Anthony Hopkins) and an ambitious young district attorney (Ryan Gosling) become locked in a deadly battle of wits when the former is found innocent in the attempted murder of his wife in director Gregory Hoblit's tense tale of courtroom mind games. Ted Crawford (Hopkins) is an engineer who lives with his wife, Jennifer (Embeth Davidtz), in the couple's lavish Southern California home. One day, after carefully planning out the details to ensure that there is no way he can be convicted of murder, Ted shoots his wife in a blatant attempt to kill the woman. When head hostage negotiator Rob Nunally (Billy Burke) arrives on the scene to speak with Ted, he is shocked to find that the victim of the shooting is in fact his longtime lover. Though Jennifer survives the trauma of being shot in the head at close range, she hovers comatose between life and death as star prosecutor Willy Beachum (Gosling) reluctantly accepts the case while preparing to leave the Los Angeles criminal court system behind for a more promising career at a posh private law firm. Though the DA (David Strathairn) vehemently resents Beachum's lofty plan for departure, the hotshot young lawyer remains convinced that he can expedite the apparently open-and-shut case and be on his way to greener pastures in one week's time at the very most. Beachum's swelling ego betrays him, however, as his future boss Nikki Gardner (Rosamund Pike) begins to turn up the heat and fracture mechanics specialist Ted chooses to represent himself at the trial knowing well that a career spent spotting structural flaws in aeronautical systems has instilled him with just the kind of argumentative skills needed to riddle the swaggering young lawyer's "foolproof" case with doubt(n)

programme.title: San Francisco 2.0
programme.desc: Filmmaker Alexandra Pelosi returns to the city of her birth to examine the effects of the technology industry on San Francisco's culture, identity, real-estate market, economy, neighborhoods and history, and discusses its past, present and future with politicians, entrepreneurs, journalists, small-business owners and lifelong residents(n)

programme.title: Meet the Donors: Does Money Talk?
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi looks at money in politics and interviews wealthy donors to Republican and Democratic parties to ask them about their contributions and philosophies. Also: a look at efforts to enact campaign-finance reform(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Tom Stoppard provided the witty and intelligent script for John Madden's romantic comedy in which young Will Shakespeare struggles with writer's block and money worries while trying to complete Romeo and Ethel: The Pirate's Daughter. Gwyneth Paltrow once more employs her faultless English accent, playing aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who is shortly to be married off but yearns to slum it as an actor. Disguising herself as a boy in order to be allowed on stage, Viola becomes Will's muse, and the more familiar tale of Romeo and Juliet begins to take shape as the couple fall passionately in love. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Sinclair Broadcast Group. The Sinclair Broadcast Group and its ownership of local U.S. television stations; and Donald Trump's tweets about Mika Brzezinski are discussed(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire
programme.desc: Speaking to a San Francisco journalist, vampire Louis tells the remarkable tale of his 200-year association with the vicious vampire Lestat(n)

programme.title: Behind the Candelabra
programme.desc: The story of flamboyant musician Liberace's tempestuous relationship with his much younger lover Scott Thorson(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Screenwriter-director M. Night Shyamalan's thriller about a security guard who thinks he may have special powers after surviving a horrific train wreck(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realize that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Oscar-winning special effects propel this magical fantasy about the adventures of a brave orphan girl who goes on an epic quest in an alternate world to rescue a kidnapped friend(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: An accountant is pulled into the deadly world of espionage by his former nerdy classmate who is now a CIA assassin(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: Petrolhead Speed lives to race, but will big business get in his way?(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Hard-partying pals Jason (T.J. Miller) and Evan (Adam Pally) break up the wedding of their friend Nardo (Thomas Middleditch), since they're convinced that he's making a huge mistake. When Nardo finds himself in increasingly dire and bizarre circumstances during a trip to Mexico to win back his bride-to-be, his buds decide to stage a wild rescue. Alison Brie, Krysten Ritter, and Jason Mantzoukas co-star in this comedy of errors directed by Scot Armstrong(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: A pop singer receives threatening notes and her manager hires a bodyguard. He ruffles the singer's feathers and most of her entourage by tightening security more than they feel is necessary. Eventually, the bodyguard and the singer start an affair and she begins to believe his precautions are necessary(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonising that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.sub-title: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change
programme.desc: Future of Firearms & Russia 'Wins' Climate Change. A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Jeff Nichols (Midnight Special, Mud) wrote and directed this biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving (played by Joel Edgerton and Ruth Negga), who were sentenced to prison in 1958 for violating the state's laws against miscegenation. The Lovings decided to fight back, and their case led to a landmark Supreme Court decision that struck down laws prohibiting interracial marriage(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy

programme.desc: Hard-partying pals Jason (T.J. Miller) and Evan (Adam Pally) break up the wedding of their friend Nardo (Thomas Middleditch), since they're convinced that he's making a huge mistake. When Nardo finds himself in increasingly dire and bizarre circumstances during a trip to Mexico to win back his bride-to-be, his buds decide to stage a wild rescue. Alison Brie, Krysten Ritter, and Jason Mantzoukas co-star in this comedy of errors directed by Scot Armstrong(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Kirsten Sheridan's family drama stars Freddie Highmore as Evan Taylor, a musical prodigy searching for his parents. When pregnant cellist Lyla Novacek was hit by a car, her controlling father and manager told her she'd lost the baby; in reality she gave birth prematurely and her father sent the infant to an orphanage. Eleven years later, when Evan finds out that his parents are alive, he sets out to find them, taking inspiration from the music around him. The heart of the film is Evan's almost mystical ability to 'feel' music, a challenging concept that is rendered believable thanks to inventive work from the composer of the main score, Mark Mancina. Also starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Evan's rock singer father, and Robin Williams as a modern-day Fagin who Evan meets during his search for his family(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Eight brave sled dogs search for the master who is looking for a way to rescue them in this adventure drama. An American geologist (Bruce Greenwood) flies to Antarctica to participate in a project at the United States Research Base, where he teams up with arctic guide Jerry Shepard (Paul Walker) and his best friend, Cooper (Jason Biggs). The scientist soon discovers that Shepard also has eight other valuable friends -- a pack of sled dogs he's worked with for years, who have rescued him from a number of tight spots. As the three men explore a frozen mountain region, an unexpected accident coupled with a massive storm front forces them to fly to safety, leaving the dogs behind. Shepard is determined to rescue his canine friends, but he has to wait until the weather will allow him to travel back to the mountain, while the dogs struggle against the elements to survive as they attempt to make their way back home. Eight Below was inspired by a true story involving Japanese researchers exploring the Antarctic in 1957; the story was made into the film Nankyoku Monogatari(n)

Pierce Brosnan, Stellan Skarsgard and Colin Firth are the likeliest suspects. Christine Baranaski, Julie Walters, Dominic Cooper(n)

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' Horton Hears a Who!
programme.desc: Dr. Seuss's beloved tale of a faithful, sharp-eared elephant (voice of Jim Carrey) trying to save a microscopic world only he can hear comes to life in this clever animated comedy. It may be computer generated, but it stays true to the charm---and the message---of the original story. Also featuring the voices of Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City
programme.desc: Three flawed individuals search for a violent justice on the rain-soaked, crime-ridden streets of Basin City(n)

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: British ex-con Wilson arrives in Los Angeles to investigate the mystery of his daughter's "accidental" death. His prime suspect, the wealthy, heavily guarded, music promoter Terry Valentine, is no easy target. Propelled into an increasingly brutal search for truth, Wilson, with single-mindedness and terrifying precision, moves unstoppably toward revenge(n)

programme.title: Nothing but Trouble
programme.desc: A businessman finds he and his friends the prisoners of a sadistic judge and his equally odd family in the backwoods of a bizarre mansion(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A loner protecting a baby from hit men(n)

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: Manuel Smoke Galloway is the leader of the Black Knights, an underground motorcycle club. Smoke, like most of his fellow Knights, is a successful white collar worker who can afford fancy leathers and top quality bikes, and Smoke has earned a reputation as the King of Cali, willing take on anyone in a drag race, legal or no. Kid is a gifted young rider whose father was once Smoke's mechanic; when Kid's dad died after an accident, Kid set out to become the best biker he could be to carry on his father's name and reputation(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Snow Angels
programme.desc: Director/screenwriter David Gordon Green adapts Stewart O'Nan's popular novel to the screen in this feature, which tells the parallel tales of a teenager named Arthur (Michael Angarano) and his onetime babysitter Annie (Kate Beckinsale) -- whose turbulent relationship with her estranged husband, Glenn (Sam Rockwell), leads the small-town waitress down a troubled path. Arthur is a high-school student from a dysfunctional family, and does everything in his power to avoid hanging around the house while mom and dad quarrel. When he's not practicing his trombone and performing with the high-school marching band, Arthur can usually be found bussing tables at the local Chinese restaurant and flirting with older waitress Annie. Annie used to be Arthur's babysitter, and is currently struggling to separate from her former high-school sweetheart, Glenn. But being a single mother isn't easy, especially since the troubled Glenn wants nothing more than to clean up his act and reunite his family. Back at school, Arthur and pretty classmate Lila (Olivia Thirlby) have been bonding over their mutual love for all things geeky. Though the casual friendship shows promise of evolving into something more when Lila expresses her true feelings for Arthur, he can't help but becoming distracted by his chaotic family life: his father is moving out of the family home, and his mother is doing everything in her power to maintain some semblance of normalcy. Realizing that happiness is fleeting as his family becomes shattered and Annie experiences a series of distressing encounters with Glenn, Arthur gradually begins to fall for Lisa despite his growing cynicism concerning long-term relationships. Later, on a cold winter morning, Glenn and Annie's past catches up with them in a blinding flash, and the lives of everyone they know are suddenly and irrevocably changed(n)

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: To finish a mission, a dangerous and unpredictable prisoner is implanted with a dead CIA agent's memories and skills(n)

programme.title: The Order

programme.title: Crimson Peak

programme.title: The Children

programme.desc: A cop in a hi-tech "pre-crime" unit in 2054 goes on the run after being labelled as a future killer. In order to prove his innocence, he kidnaps one of the psychics who predicts the imminent crimes while eluding a determined government agent(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: Bret Gives Up the Dream. Murray tells the boys to get a job because the band has no money. But when Bret's sign-holding career gets in the way of the band, Murray fires him. Jemaine has to continue with a tape recorder. Features the songs Inner City Pressure and She's So Hot...Boom!(n)

programme.title: Formula 51
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays a pharmaceutical genius who has used his knowledge to make a fortune in illegal drugs, particularly with Formula 51, named after its potency above heroin, crack, anything. But instead of selling it to his drug lord employer, he jets to Liverpool where Robert Carlyle is acting as broker for Ricky Tomlinson, who's prepared to offer $20m for the formula - money Jackson would love to spend if he can stay alive long enough in Ronny Yu's fast moving crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This fascinating reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the scientist builds an undead creature that turns dangerous, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Doomsday
programme.desc: A lethal virus spreads throughout Scotland, infecting millions and killing hundreds of thousands. To contain the threat, acting authorities brutally quarantine the country as it succumbs to fear and chaos. Three decades later, the Reaper virus violently resurfaces in London. An elite group of specialists is urgently dispatched to retrieve a cure by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: The Quest
programme.desc: A petty criminal in 1920s New York City is enslaved by gun smugglers and sold to pirates who force him into the underworld of gambling and kickboxing. Jean-Claude Van Damme, Roger Moore, James Remar, Janet Gunn, Jack McGee, Louis Mandylor(n)

programme.title: Mystic River
programme.desc: Childhood friends Jimmy, Sean and Dave are reunited by a tragedy involving one of their children. As homicide detective Sean investigates, Jimmy enlists his relatives to launch their own inquiry. Later, suspicions fall on Jimmy and Sean's old friend Dave(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.desc: Episode 161. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Wes Craven Presents: Dracula 2000
programme.desc: In this loose reinvention of the classic Bram Stoker novel, the Count (Gerard Butler) is transplanted to the present day, after a brief prologue where Van Helsing (Christopher Plummer) captures Dracula and conceals him in Carfax Abbey, where he remains for many years. In the future, Carfax Abbey is contained within an office building where Van Helsing's been using Dracula's blood to stay alive in order to guard the evil secret. After a band of thieves, led by the malevolent Marcus (Omar Epps), attempts to seize Dracula's remains, the Count escapes to New Orleans, where Mary Van Helsing (Justine Waddell) currently resides. Mary is eventually persuaded to fight Dracula with the aid of a reluctant Simon(Jonny Lee Miller), one of Van Helsing's employees, all while trying to escape the newly-made vampires of Marcus' gang and a zealous TV reporter (Jeri Ryan). The film also features Lochlyn Munro, Jennifer Esposito, Vitamin C, and Danny Masterson in supporting roles(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Viggo Mortensen and Ed Harris star with Academy Award winner Renée Zellweger as two gunmen tracking an escaped murderer and a beautiful, dangerous widow with an agenda of her own whose paths collide in the lawless western town of Appaloosa. When Virgil Cole (Harris--A History of Violence) and Everett Hitch (Mortensen--A History of Violence, The Lord of the Rings films) arrive in Appaloosa, they find a small, dusty town suffering at the hands of a renegade rancher with so little regard for the law that he has taken supplies, horse and women for his own and left the city marshal and one of his deputies for dead. Cole and Hitch, itinerant lawmen, are used to cleaning up after opportunistic thieves, but this time they find an unusually wily adversary--one who raises the stakes not by playing with the rules, but with emotions.Written and directed by Ed Harris, based on the novel by Robert B. Parker(n)

programme.title: Closed Circuit
programme.desc: A major terrorism trial ensnares two ex-lovers who both play crucial roles on the defense team in this gripping thriller. When the lead defense attorney dies, his replacement proves to be the former lover of a Special Advocate with clearance to view classified evidence(n)

programme.title: East Side Sushi
programme.desc: East Side Sushi tells the story of Juana (Diana Elizabeth Torres), a Latina single mother living in East Oakland who dreams of becoming a sushi chef despite the fact that it's a job traditionally held almost exclusively by Japanese men. Undeterred, Juana embarks on a journey of self-discovery and re-ignites her zest for food and life. The drama is the first feature film from director Anthony Lucero, who also penned the script(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: This spirited romp is a throwback to classic screwball comedies of the 1930s and '40s. Eva Longoria Parker is a scream as a bride who suffers a fatal accident during her wedding, and later returns as a ghost to keep her husband from taking a new lover. Paul Rudd is outstanding as her husband; Lake Bell is a treat as the new woman in his life, a caterer who doubles as a psychic; and Lindsay Sloane is impressive as his kooky sister, Chloe. Written and directed by Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.desc: The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it(n)

programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.desc: Thriller with a comical twist, following a desperate man who decides to raise money by staging his own wife's kidnapping. Car dealer Jerry Lundegaard (William H Macy) lives in small-town Minnesota and is currently facing bankruptcy. As a last resort, he teams up with a pair of crooks, Showalter (Steve Buscemi) and Grimsrud (Peter Stormare), to kidnap his wife and demand an $80,000 ransom from her wealthy father. But the kidnapping is a disaster and local police chief Marge Gunderson (Frances McDormand), an affable woman in the final stages of her pregnancy, launches an investigation into what has become a murder case(n)

But in 2010, she lured an innocent man to a dark alleyway where her friends were waiting to rob him. Instead he ended up being shot dead. Even though she didn't pull the trigger, and was nowhere near when the bullets were fired, Jennifer was sentenced to life without parole. programme.desc: Peter and Lois decide not to vaccinate Stewie after reading about potential side effects, but the rest of Quahog follows suit and Sean Penn has to save the day when disease spreads.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois fulfils a lifelong ambition by becoming a model, much to the displeasure of Peter and her father. Meanwhile, Brian works for Stewie's marketing company to pay for the treatment of an embarrassing problem.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Adventures of Twill Ongenbone and His Boy Jabari.
programme.desc: Francine tries to teach Roger the value of hard work when his character `Twill Ongenbone' fakes a degree in archaeology. However, she quickly regrets her decision, leaving him to resort to desperate measures to regain her faith.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A dark secret about the Smith family is revealed when Francine throws Stan a birthday party and invites his incarcerated father to the celebration.(n)

programme.title: CelebAbility
programme.desc: Famous faces Megan McKenna, Will Best, Keith Duffy, Ola Jordan and Stephen Bailey take on five friends in a series of challenges. Game show, hosted by Iain Stirling.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star.(n)

programme.title: Hans Christian Andersen: My Life as a Fairy Tale
programme.desc: Conclusion of the storyteller's rags-to-riches tale, giving an insight into the people who inspired his fantasy world. Drama, starring Kieran Bew, James Fox, Simon Callow, Emily Hamilton, Geraldine James and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Liz Merrick faces a trying time when one of her patients misses an appointment to discuss medication, and subsequently ends up charged with drink-driving, while Vernon's pal David is kidnapped and held to ransom. Merton is delighted Jenny has agreed to marry him, and Bellamy finds out that Gina is carrying his baby. Rural drama, starring Aislin McGuckin, Geoffrey Hughes and Duncan Bell.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An old friend of Merton is sent from CID to help track down a bank robber, and he agrees to be best man at the wedding, while Jenny's disgraced brother Steve tries to patch things up with his sister before she ties the knot. Events conspire to jeopardise the special day and stop the happy couple making it to the church on time. Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey, Mark Jordon and Tricia Penrose star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica enters the world of haute couture to solve a series of murders committed in the seedy surroundings of a Parisian sweatshop, and the lover of a model who helped her research a book is targeted by a killer in Paris. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Oh! To Be in England - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Preparations get under way for the christening, while Primrose loses her heart to a very confused vicar. Pop gets a black eye, Edith Pilchester tackles a gang of roving Teddy boys and Mademoiselle Dupont begins to feel ill. Drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes disguises himself as a plumber to gain access to the home of a blackmailing art dealer who targets members of high society. Robert Hardy guest stars in a feature-length episode of the period drama, with Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Kersey and Lane investigate the death of a fisherman, who was killed while at sea, and find EC quotas are taking their toll in more ways than one. They also discover a new sense of rivalry in their working relationship, but a bit of healthy competition could give them the edge they need to solve the case. Jack Shepherd stars, with Jimmy Yuill and Helen Masters.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: American GIs arrive in Hastings to a mixed welcome and Foyle is called on to calm the locals. But his attempts at soothing relations are jeopardised when a barmaid's involvement with a visiting soldier results in murder, leading the detective to defy orders to keep the peace and solve the case. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell, Honeysuckle Weeks and Keith Barron.(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Aunt Joan reveals she has a rare bird nesting on her land but wants to keep it a secret to deter prospective egg thieves. Sure enough, her tactless nephew opens his mouth to the local baker, who spies an opportunity to save his ailing business by making it a new attraction. Before long the peaceful community of Portwenn is over-run by twitchers eager to catch a sight of the bird, and Dr Ellingham finds himself in the locals' bad books yet again. Martin Clunes stars in this Christmas special of the comedy drama, originally shown in 2006.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise 2: The Treasure Hunt
programme.desc: Sequel to the 2003 one-off comedy drama, in which Dave, Rob and Maurice embark on a two-day charity treasure hunt. They're joined by Dave's wife Cath, keen to make sure her husband sticks to his diet, Daniel, who's back from France and worrying he may not be the father of his pregnant wife's baby, and Marcus Forster, a potential client of Dave, who's not exactly the most pleasant fellow they've ever met. The only trouble is, everyone has to be nice to him if Dave's going to bag a new contract.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The hunt for the killer of a seemingly innocent family man brings Ronnie into contact with his old boss, former DI Natalie Chandler, whose father is accused of the crime. She wastes no time in persuading the detective to go above and beyond the call of duty to exonerate her dad and find the real culprit - even if that means getting him into trouble with an increasingly frustrated Wes. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Harriet Walter, Martin Jarvis and Roy Hudd.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When the body of an elderly woman is discovered at a well-known suicide spot, Ronnie soon detects foul play, with suspicion falling on the victim's son and daughter-in-law, as well as a doctor who has recently arrived in the UK. However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl is snatched from a troubled housing estate, presenting a fresh challenge for clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill, who sets about trying to build up a profile of her abductor before time runs out. Unfortunately the case turns into a murder inquiry with the discovery of her body, and the team is left racing to save another innocent life. Robson Green and Simone Lahbib star.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The murder of two youngsters in ritual slayings lead the police into a case of black magic - and things soon become more incredible, from animal sacrifices and paintings in blood to two of the team apparently cursed by voodoo dolls. Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killer's next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: The property-comparing contest arrives in Manchester, where aquatics teacher Paul Howe shows off the cotton mill-worker's cottage he and his fiancee managed to improve on a budget. Clutter-hating Rafael Kepa provides a tour of his city-centre penthouse, and charity consultant Salli Ward opens up the narrow boat she shares with her husband. Finally Neil Roland invites his fellow competitors into his lovingly restored Victorian home. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four homeowners from Cumbria rate each other's properties, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. Under inspection is Brian Hewitt's converted stable, Lesley Hornsby's 19th-century home, Graham Wynn's modern dwelling and Jannett Forrest's detached bungalow. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. Then, when the job is finished, he unwinds in a gay bar and is attacked by a homophobic thug - losing his wallet in the process. programme.desc: Henry Winkler, William Shatner, Terry Bradshaw and George Foreman visit Kyoto, Japan, a magical ancient city where William is determined to `find his Zen'. They begin with a trip to a geisha house, where they eat, drink and drink some more, and later visit a samurai warrior school. Then they set off to Hong Kong where they stay at one of the world's top hotels, rent a yacht and have custom-made suits designed by the best tailors. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: The family prepares for a celebration, and Margo is determined to persuade the reclusive Countess Mavrodaki to attend. Sven is put to the test by his potential family, but seems to make a good impression. Gerry begins to question whether keeping animals in his personal zoo is fair, and considers releasing them into the wild.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: The Americans

programme.title: Tutankhamun

Carter's relationship with the press also causes problems for Carnarvon, driving a wedge between the two men in their hour of triumph.(n)

programme.title: Vera

As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Mo and fiance Jon, who could not agree on anything when they were searching for their first house together in Birmingham. They also revisit Liz and John, who had a long list of criteria, including space for bikes and canoes, when they were hunting for their `forever home' in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer revists Steve and Sally, who wanted to relocate to the Warwickshire countryside. They had a long wish list for their ideal property, plus the added pressure of finding a home before the birth of their first child. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp is in Northamptonshire catching up Rinku and Sunder, whose home was due for demolition, leaving them with a deadline to move out.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two previous clients helped in their property search by he and Kirstie Allsopp. Professional rugby player Alex and teacher Sarah wanted to relocate from Penarth near Cardiff to west London, only to get a shock when they realised the speed of the capital's property market. Meanwhile, Kirstie assisted Naomi, who was after a place in Hemel Hempstead with enough room for her pole-dancing equipment. How have they both got on since first featuring on the show?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Craig Alexander Wilson hosts the first party in Glasgow, hoping his edible glitter and sparklers will impress his fellow diners. However, his guests are less than overawed when he tries to guess their ages, hampering his chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paul Cowan hosts the second dinner party in Glasgow, but his penchant for practical jokes threatens to overshadow his menu, which includes steak Balmoral with whisky sauce and the enigmatically named Paul's Cream Puff.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mandy Wong hopes to impress her guests at the third dinner party in Glasgow with an Asian cuisine-inspired menu. Unfortunately for her, Caroline Wardrope has to run to the bathroom during the host's Latin dance routine, and a disastrous dessert further hampers her bid for success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Music teacher and professional flautist Siobhan Daly hosts the fourth dinner party challenge in Glasgow, and plans to impress her guests with a rock and pop icons-themed evening. She begins by preparing a cod and chorizo stew before showing off her piano skills for dessert.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Caroline Wardrope hosts the final dinner party in Glasgow, and throws a 1970s-themed disco evening with a mystery menu. The diners seem to enjoy the surprise dishes and are shocked to learn the truth about the host's secret profession, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fun-loving Sonya Smith is the first to host the dinner-party challenge from Reading, Berkshire, and aims to win over the guests with a Touch of Sparkle theme. Aware her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired, she hopes to bungle her way through the night, and though she is amused by the kitchen chaos, not everyone is impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Londoner Glen Wilkie hosts the second dinner party of the week in Reading, Berkshire, and is confident of victory. However, a disaster with his dessert gets the day off to a bad start, and his main course, which he has chosen to call Bambi on a Plate, leaves one guest in tears - while another flatly refuses to eat it.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Richard Howse hosts the third dinner party in Reading, using a menu and set of instructions provided by his girlfriend to guide him. A treasure hunt brings out Glen Wilkie's feelings about Serine Daou, Sonya Smith dislikes some of the gluten-free food and, for the third night in a row, Sabi Phagura is served a plate of meat she will not eat.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in Reading sees fitness fanatic Sabi Phagura putting her healthy regimen to one side to host a bhangra-themed evening. Unfortunately, neither the traditional Indian food on the table nor the entertainment seems to impress the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Corset-maker Serine Daou hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Reading, Berkshire, and hopes to impress with her burlesque-themed party. When the gourmet burgers she serves fail to impress, she must rely on the evening's entertainment to put her back on course for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. Kendari the babirusa - a bizarre-looking creature also known as a deer-pig - is trying to give birth, but is being disturbed by a couple of mischievous otters. Young male orang-utan Willie struggles to impress the females, while Raz the aye-aye, a rare nocturnal primate related to lemurs, is being encouraged to share his home with two jumping rats.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Jack is hauled off to the local old priests' home to be treated for a strange medical complaint. He is replaced by a younger man - who proceeds to drive everyone crazy by playing jungle music at ear-splitting volume for hours on end. Dermot Morgan and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The Craggy Island clerics face the prospect of an untimely death during the return flight from a visit to a holy shrine. Jack quickly commandeers the only parachute and bails out, taking the drinks trolley with him - leaving Ted and Dougal to their fate.(n)

programme.title: Sarah Millican - Home Bird Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded in 2014 at Newcastle's Tyne Theatre & Opera House, in which the comedienne shares humorous insights into her life, including the need to put down some roots now she has cats. Plus, she offers advice on what to take away on a dirty weekend, how to teach a pensioner to swear and the correct number of meals to consume in a day.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jessica Hynes and guest captain David Walliams take on Jon Richardson and Rhod Gilbert. Sam Simmons joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. Kendari the babirusa - a bizarre-looking creature also known as a deer-pig - is trying to give birth, but is being disturbed by a couple of mischievous otters. Young male orang-utan Willie struggles to impress the females, while Raz the aye-aye, a rare nocturnal primate related to lemurs, is being encouraged to share his home with two jumping rats.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show, joined by team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson and guests Paul Hollywood, Dawn O'Porter, Joe Wilkinson and Rob Beckett, to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Retired teacher Theresa Robinson and her GP husband Alan are planning to relocate from Norfolk to Spain's Costa Brava. The couple have a budget of £250,000, and Sara Damergi takes them to view five potential homes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Vale of Berkeley Guest House in Gloucestershire, where owners Harri and Claire Chiba hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, two guests from rival B&Bs have an issue with the no-frills toilet, and another places a tricky request for `anaemic toast' at the breakfast table.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Artist Residence in Penzance, Cornwall, where proprietors Justin and Charlie hope to impress their rivals with a pottery class. However, one pair decide their room is too modern for their tastes, a duo are shocked to find hair in a shower filter and one guest seems underwhelmed by breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are Alec and Craig Coleman, who open the doors to the Edenfield Guest House in Blackpool and invite their fellow B&B owners to rate their establishment. However, on arrival one of the guests and his wife discover stains on the bedspread, while others feel the `award-winning' food is not up to scratch.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the New Inn, Portland, Dorset, for the fourth day of the competition, where hosts Stacey and Spencer Cullum introduce their guests to a typical island activity - sandcastle building. Meanwhile, Claire Chiba quizzes Stacey about her breakfast hamper and says she is alienating customers, before Harri Chiba tells Justin that his B&B is too `manufactured'.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. Two contestants attempt to explain away their negative feedback, and one contender finds herself unable to hold back her frustration, before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: House-hunters Jonathan Joyce and Julia Hobson search for a holiday home in Costa Almeria, Spain. They require a place with good rental potential and sea views on a budget of around £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Laura Hamilton helps Rodney and Lynda Palliser from Hertfordshire search for their dream holiday home near the upmarket, cosmopolitan city of Palma - the capital of Majorca - on a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Castle Howard, Yorkshire: Not a Blot on the Landscape.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team are invited to search for the remains of a medieval village that was razed to make way for Castle Howard in North Yorkshire. With just three days to find evidence of the inhabitants, the dig proves to be something of a challenge - until a dusty cellar yields its secrets.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Sedgefield, Co Durham: A View to a Kiln.
programme.desc: The experts examine aerial photographs of fields on the outskirts of Sedgefield in Co Durham, which reveal what appears to be a lost Roman town. If their hypothesis is correct it would be the most northerly Roman civilian settlement yet discovered. Plus, the team receives a visit from former prime minister Tony Blair, the one-time MP for Sedgefield.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw, master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and a team of experts head to Eastbourne in East Sussex to take on an iconic French front-wheel drive car. The vehicle in question is a 1954 Citroen Traction Avant belonging to former watchmaker and classic car lover Andrew.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces a new challenge when he is called upon to save the life of a buzzard with a broken wing. A couple's beloved labrador turns up at the clinic with badly damaged elbow joints, and a pampered cat that is used to living the good life faces surgery to repair slipping knee-caps.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Bengal cat called Tia is rushed in to Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a car. Noel Fitzpatrick faces the painstakingly difficult task of reconstructing Tia's tiny bones using a combination of rods and pins. Whippet Wobble, a rescue dog, is so badly injured that Noel has no choice but to perform a high-risk operation, and Alfie, a labrador care-dog, arrives at the surgery in need of help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Robert and Milla Gaukroger, as they try to add three extensions to a 1980s property overlooking Lake Windermere in the Lake District. Robert has designed his own heating system to achieve maximum sustainability, but the project begins with only £100,000 of the £400,000 budget in place, and he and his family have to move into the existing building while work goes on around them.(n)

programme.title: Secret History
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Terracotta Warriors - Secret History.
programme.desc: The unearthing of China's Terracotta Army in 1974 captured the imagination of the world, but that first dig only revealed a fraction of this extraordinary collection of ceramic sculptures. Since then, scientists have resumed work on the site, and their research has turned up a series of fresh discoveries about the warriors and the people who made them more than 2,000 years ago. With access to pioneering research conducted by UCL and the Terracotta Army Museum, this documentary reveals those new secrets.(n)

programme.title: Convicted for Love
programme.desc: To mark the 50th anniversary of the partial decriminalisation of homosexuality in England and Wales, this documentary tells the stories four gay men who fell foul of Britain's laws.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow Mohammed, 64, who has been hit by a pizza delivery motorbike. Consultant Will is concerned that he may have a pelvic fracture, which could seriously affect his mobility and, if it hits a major artery, can be life threatening. There's also a profile of John, a 90 year old who comes to St George's in south west London with his wife Iris and daughter Joan after his GP picked up on his abnormally low heart rate.(n)

programme.desc: Interviews with celebrities and newsmakers are conducted on a Brooklyn stoop(n)

programme.title: My Life Is a Zoo
programme.desc: The Hippo Has Landed. June has just begun, but the DeYoung Family Zoo, a privately owned zoo in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, is already well into its busy summer season. Bud and Carrie are always on the go and, on top of all their day-to-day chores, the zoo's largest new arrival is on its way from Jakarta, Indonesia. After an 11,000-mile journey, Wallace, a 400-pound baby hippo, is already proving to Bud and Carrie that he may be a kid, but he's calling all the shots! With a lot of coaxing and the help of some tasty carrots, the DeYoung Family Zoo finally welcomes its new hippo -- now Bud and Carrie just have to feed him! To add to the stress, Carrie has just started a no-kill animal rescue - Piper's Place - and is hoping that a fundraising event will bring in the money she needs. The balloons are up and the cake is cut, but can Carrie raise the thousands of dollars needed to keep Piper's Place afloat?(n)

programme.desc: Joanne Cantwell presents coverage of day four of the European Tour event, held this year at Portstewart Golf Club in Londonderry, Northern Ireland. Several of the leading players at last year's tournament held at the K Club had to conclude their third round on the morning of day four before returning to the course for their final round. Going into that, Rory McIlroy began with a three-stroke lead over his nearest rival, Danny Willett, and a three-under-par round was enough to see him claim this title for the first time in his career. programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
